**Corporate Overview**: World Food Championships Holdings (WFCH) is a partnership with  
Endeavor/IMG aimed at growing The World Food Championships (WFC) into a global powerhouse of food sport events, television derivatives, consumer products, licensing, merchandising and talent management. Essentially, American Idol for Food.

WFC is the highest-stakes Food Sports competition in the world. This multi-day, live event culinary competition showcases some of the world's best cooks who compete for food, fame and fortune in 12 categories (Bacon, Barbecue, Burger, Chef, Cocktail, Dessert, Live Fire,  
Rice/Noodle, Sandwich, Seafood, Soup and Vegetarian). Each year as Food Sport kicks off in  
January, thousands of cook teams try to earn their way into WFC by winning a Golden Ticket at an official qualifier. Almost 40 countries and every state in America have been represented at  
WFC’s main event since its inception in 2012.

The World Mixology Championships also debuted at the WFC 2023 event and will be a significant corporate focus in the coming years.

title: Freelance Project Coordinator
description:
**Position Available:** Freelance Project Coordinator

**Company:** Boules Consulting

**Hours:** Freelance (up to 10 hours/week). Your schedule will be completely flexible – as long as you get everything done by the deadline at the expected level of quality, you will have a high amount of independence and autonomy. However, we do have quite a few client meetings that you must be able to attend, so you should be able to have some flexibility in your schedule for Pacific Standard Time (PST) work hours.

**Setting:** 100% remote. We have a headquarter office in Costa Mesa, CA, however, our small team of 10 works virtually as well. Note: you must already have a laptop/microphone/webcam/internet to work virtually, as these will not be provided.

**Pay:** $16-18/hour DOE

**About Boules Consulting**

At Boules Consulting, we believe that people are more important than profits. So, we offer technical writing, consulting, and strategic planning services for social enterprises such as nonprofits, small businesses, and government agencies with a mission to make a lasting, meaningful, positive impact on our communities. For the last 5 years, we have differentiated ourselves through our ability to synthesize analytical and outcome-driven data with compelling storytelling and effective document development. Some of our clients include Breast Cancer Angels, Rebirth Homes, and the Centennial Farm Foundation, among dozens of others.

At Boules Consulting, we value creativity, strong work-ethic, autonomy, reliability, growth of our team members, and work/life balance. We believe that leaders should be kind and invest in their people. Our team practices confident vulnerability, meaning we are equally confident about our strengths and our weaknesses. We communicate directly and transparently with each other, and while we hold each other to high standards of production, we always put people before numbers.

**Why We’re Hiring a Project Coordinator**

Since Boules Consulting was founded in 2018, we have doubled in size each year. This fast pace of growth has stretched our ability to effectively deliver on all of the business we are getting, and so we need to add a talented Project Coordinator to our team of experts so we can continue serving our clients with excellence. For example, some current projects we’ve just wrapped up include managing an COVID-19 equity project, a $25M grant to bring electric vehicles into California, and a $160M economic development project design.

**Position Overview**

As the freelance project coordinator for Boules Consulting, you play a critical role in ensuring that projects, ideas, and initiatives that result in meaningful and sustainable social impact. The project coordinator is responsible for ensuring that grant templates are created, workflows are developed and managed, and grant proposals are submitted in an efficient and timely manner. Importantly, the Project Coordinator is detail-oriented with sniper-like attention to deadlines, eligibility requirements, formatting requirements, and submission requirements of grant proposals. This is an exciting opportunity to make a tangible difference in the world by helping to drive positive change through social entrepreneurship.

**Key Responsibilities**

* **Onboarding:** Helps onboard new clients by following direct SOPs
* **Startup**: Work with Operations Assistant and CEO to set up project management workflows on ClickUp
* **Manage**: Manage workflow on ClickUp, making sure that project tasks are being completed on time
* **Coordinate**: Coordinate with clients as needed to obtain proper documents and approvals
* **Schedule:** Schedule meetings with clients and Boules Consulting team as needed, taking copious notes by integrating AI into each meeting
* **Monitor**: Manage dummy emails, usernames, and passwords for each client
* **Assistance**: Assist in organizing Google Drive and ClickUp
* Work with Operations assistant and CEO to ensure deliverables are being met on government contracts
* **Projects**: Help clients with obtaining business certifications
* **Tracks**: Inputs time worked on projects via ClickUp

**Talents to Thrive in This Role**

* Excels in prioritizing, arranging, re-arranging and coordinating changes on many different projects simultaneously.
* Ability to customize your approach to each individual client and their needs.
* Accountable: takes deep personal ownership over tasks and responsibilities.
* Adaptable: calm in the middle of the storm.
* Determination: The ability to see things through
* This is a fully remote position, so you should be able to self-manage, adhere to deadlines on your own, constantly communicate with your team, complete deliverables assigned to you, not be afraid to ask for help when you come up across a hurdle, and have a sense of ownership over your work
* Experience with government agencies, non-profit organizations, and/or grant management is a plus

**Manager Profile for This Position**

This position will report to the Operations Assistant. The Operations Assistant is a problem-solver and someone who seeks to uplift the unique qualities of each person and bring out the best of their talents and interests. As someone who is detail-oriented and goal-focused, the Operations Assistant will guide trainees through the learning process step by step to help them achieve their own sense of rhythm and fulfillment. They will always available to provide helpful resources and encouraging feedback on tasks and projects and values timely, high-quality work.. If you are someone who prefers their own working style and a dependable, supportive source of feedback, Angelina will be a great leader for you.

**How to Apply**

To be considered for the opportunity, you MUST send the following items to

* A one page cover letter summarizing your experience as a project manager and your familiarity with ClickUp, Zoom, Google Drive, and AI meeting integration
* Your resume with contact info and references included.
* To be considered for the position you must write: “I Believe in Social Impact” in the subject line.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $16.00 - $18.00 per hour

Expected hours: 2 – 10 per week

Compensation package:

* 1099 contract

Experience level:

* 1 year

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

Work Location: Remote

title: Clinical Quality Assurance Coordinator
description:
Overview:

Are you an experienced Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN or LVN) or Registered Nurse (RN) looking for your next opportunity?  

MCMC is seeking a **\\*Remote\\*** **Clinical QA Coordinator** **(LPN/RN)** to join our team!  

This position is **100% remote** and the schedule will be **Monday- Friday** **11:30am-8pm EST** ***(occasional holiday coverage required, possible weekend coverage as needed******)*****.**  

The Clinical Quality Assurance Coordinator is responsible for ensuring Peer Review case reports are of the highest quality and integrity and in full compliance with client contractual agreement, regulatory agency standards and/or federal and state mandates.

  

Want to join an employee-first company with great benefits and growth opportunities? If you think this aligns with what you desire in your next career move, apply at this very moment!
Responsibilities:
* Performs quality assurance review of peer review reports, correspondences, addendums or supplemental reviews.
* Ensures clear, concise, evidence-based rationales have been provided in support of all recommendations and/or determinations.
* Ensures that all client instructions and specifications have been followed and that all questions have been addressed.
* Ensures each review is supported by clinical citations and references when applicable and verifies that all references cited are current and obtained from reputable medical journals and/or publications.
* Ensures the content, format, and professional appearance of the reports are of the highest quality and in compliance with company standards.
* Ensure that the appropriate board specialty has reviewed the case in compliance with client specifications and/or state mandates and is documented accurately on the case report.
* Verifies that the peer reviewer has attested to only the fact(s) and that no evidence of reviewer conflict of interest exists.
* Ensures the provider credentials and signature are adhered to the final report.
* Identifies any inconsistencies within the report and contacts the Peer Reviewer to obtain clarification, modification or correction as needed.
* Assists in resolution of customer complaints and quality assurance issues as needed.
* Ensures all federal ERISA and/or state mandates are adhered to at all times.
* Provides insight and direction to management on consultant quality, availability and compliance with all company policies and procedures and client specifications.
* Promote effective and efficient utilization of company resources.
* Participate in various educational and or training activities as required.
* Perform other duties as assigned.


Qualifications:
**EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE**


High school diploma or equivalent required. A minimum of two years clinical or related field experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Knowledge of the insurance industry preferably claims management relative to one or more of the following categories: workers' compensation, no-fault, liability, and/or disability.

 **QUALIFICATIONS**

* Must have strong knowledge of medical terminology, anatomy and physiology, medications and laboratory values.
* Must be able to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers and decimals; Ability to compute rates and percentages.
* Must be a qualified typist with a minimum of 40 W.P.M
* Must be able to operate a general computer, fax, copier, scanner, and telephone.
* Must be knowledgeable of multiple software programs, including but not limited to Microsoft Word, Outlook, Excel, and the Internet.
* Must possess excellent skills in English usage, grammar, punctuation and style.
* Ability to follow instructions and respond to upper managements’ directions accurately.
* Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness.
* Must demonstrate exceptional communication skills by conveying necessary information accurately, listening effectively and asking questions where clarification is needed.
* Must be able to work independently, prioritize work activities and use time efficiently.
* Must be able to maintain confidentiality.

**About Us:**  

MCMC completes over 100,000 reviews each year for more than 400 clients, including almost all of the nation’s largest Health Plans, PBMs, Disability Carriers, TPAs, UR companies, Self-Insured Employers, Taft-Hartley Plans and Government Organizations.  

MCMC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and affords equal opportunity to all qualified applicants for all positions without regard to protected veteran status, qualified individuals with disabilities and all individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or any other status protected under local, state or federal laws. ***MCMC offers a fast-paced team atmosphere with competitive benefits (medical, vision, dental), paid time off, and 401k.*** **Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans**

title: Marketing and Events Coordinator
description:
**Company**: Merge Labs, Inc. (Merge)  

**Role**: Marketing and Events Coordinator  

**Location**: United States, Work from Home + travel  

**Benefits**: Comprehensive Medical/Dental/Life and Stock Option Plan  

**Compensation**: $60,000

 **About Merge**:  

Merge is an educational technology company that develops the award-winning Merge Cube and hands-on digital learning platform, Merge EDU. Our product ecosystem is a curriculum-aligned augmented reality solution for K-12 classrooms, libraries, STEM labs and makerspaces. Our customers are K-12 educators, administrators, and leaders.

 **Your Mission:**  

We are looking for an energetic Marketing and Events Coordinator to plan and execute marketing initiatives. These include, but are not limited to coordinating and representing Merge at events around the country, cultivating press coverage and influencers, creating presentations, and creating marketing collateral. As you achieve success at Merge, you will have growth opportunities to build and lead teams. This position will involve frequent travel.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Plan, coordinate and attend events around the country. This includes managing logistics and helping set up and staff Merge’s trade show presence
* Brainstorm, research and coordinate potential PR and marketing initiatives and programs
* Cultivate relationships with education influencers
* Host webinars about Merge EDU
* Manage Facebook group / help create engagement across social media
* Brainstorm and coordinate creation of marketing collateral assets

 **Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business, technology, or equivalent experience
* 2+ years of experience relevant to the Responsibility stated above. Experience performing such responsibilities for education technology is preferred
* Highly proficient, articulate and accurate with both written and verbal communication, including presentations
* Outstanding interpersonal skills is required
* Strong organization skills is required
* Flexible approach, able to navigate uncertainty and change
* Ability and willingness to travel for events on a fairly regular basis (expected to be approximately 2 per month) is a requirement
* Driven, self-motivated, enthusiastic and with a “can do” attitude

title: Account Coordinator - Digital Advertising
description:
Evolve Media is a political and issue-advocacy advertising agency out of DC and LA. We’re looking for a new go-getter to join our team!

We are looking for an Account Coordinator to work alongside our Account Leads team to help in overseeing a portfolio of assigned clients, ensuring that campaigns are running smoothly, reports are getting out on time, and that the account leads team feels like they have a reliable and trusted support team to help them maintain their client relationships.

You will liaise with multiple account leads to help them with their campaigns. This will involve team strategy sessions, joining client calls and meetings with them, assisting with proposals, data sourcing, data analysis, and being their second set of eyes over their work.

The work we do here at Evolve Media is extremely collaborative. This will not feel like a subordinate role as everyone really does similar work. This position sees rapid growth and promotion opportunities.

Account Coordinators are expected to be an extremely reliable, curious and are expected to take initiative in all elements of their role. The ideal candidate believes in the team and has a very positive can-do attitude and collaborative spirit.

Candidates for this role should be thorough, diligent, and curious hard workers who care about their teammate’s and client’s campaigns and are eager to think outside the box and bring new ideas to upper management. Candidates should have strong written and verbal communication skills, a thirst for knowledge, and an openness to strengthen their math aptitude.

This position is structured to develop into a Account Manager role (pending performance). There is tremendous room for growth within the company, and this is just the first step.

If you care deeply about your quality of work, we’d like to meet you.

**Responsibilities** 

* Serve as support to the account lead team
* Build and maintain strong relationships with teammates
* Help build, monitor and measure campaign performance
* Report any campaign performance variations with solutions to the account lead
* Understand the digital landscape well enough to be able to quickly pivot from supporting one account lead to another
* Extract audience data
* Connect directly with the CEO and different vendors to help find solutions *ad hoc*
* Conduct research for team leads *ad hoc*
* Join team lead client calls, emails, and correspondence *ad hoc*
* Establish open communication channels, providing the highest level of trust among teammates
* Ensure the timely and successful delivery of solutions according to account leads tea.
* Become fluent in Evolve Media’s platforms and internal processes, including but not limited to all digital platforms, audience targeting platforms, and brand lift tools.
* Maintain a positive, go-getter attitude.

**Skills** 

* Strong written, verbal, and presentation communication skills.
* Strong critical thinking skills.
* Basic Microsoft excel skills.
* The ability to multitask; juggle multiple projects at a time while maintaining sharp attention to detail.
* Strong social media knowledge (even if just pertaining to usage)
* Strong research skills
* Experience running paid campaigns in Meta, Google properties, LinkedIn, X, Roku OneView or The Tade Desk is nice to have

**Compensation:** $55k Full health and dental benefits are offered. Employees have unlimited PTO.

*Please note, although this position is fully remote, Evolve operates on EST.* 

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Experience level:

* 2 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Overtime
* Weekends as needed

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

title: Logistics Coordinator
description:
We are currently seeking a detail-oriented and highly organized Logistics Coordinator to join our team. As a Logistics Coordinator, you will play a crucial role in coordinating and managing the transportation and distribution of goods, ensuring a smooth and efficient logistics process. The ideal candidate has strong communication skills, problem-solving abilities, and a solid understanding of logistics operations.


**Responsibilities:**


* Coordinate and manage the logistics operations, including transportation, warehousing, and distribution.
* Communicate and collaborate with suppliers, vendors, and transportation providers to ensure timely and accurate delivery of goods.
* Track shipments and monitor delivery status to ensure on-time delivery.
* Prepare and maintain accurate documentation, including shipping manifests, invoices, and customs clearance documents.
* Address any issues or exceptions that arise during the transportation process and work on solutions to resolve them.
* Optimize transportation routes and modes to minimize costs and maximize efficiency.
* Maintain regular communication with internal teams and external partners to provide updates on shipment status and resolve any logistics-related issues.
* Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards, including customs regulations and safety requirements.
* Monitor and analyze key logistics metrics to identify areas for improvement and implement process enhancements.
* Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in logistics and supply chain management.


**Requirements:**


* Proven experience as a Logistics Coordinator or in a similar role.
* Strong knowledge of logistics operations and supply chain management.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills.
* Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
* Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficient in using logistics management software and tools.
* Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and attention to detail.
* Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines.
* Bachelor's degree in logistics, supply chain management, or a related field is preferred.
* Applicants must reside in the United States and possess valid authorization to work in the country.


Job Type: Full-time


**Benefits:**


* Competitive salary
* Health insurance
* Retirement savings plan
* Paid time off

title: Supply Chain Coordinator
description:
We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Supply Chain Coordinator to join our team. As a Supply Chain Coordinator, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth and efficient flow of products and materials throughout our supply chain. The ideal candidate is highly organized, possesses excellent communication and problem-solving skills, and has a strong understanding of supply chain processes.


Responsibilities:


* Coordinate and monitor the end-to-end supply chain process.
* Maintain accurate inventory records and ensure optimal stock levels.
* Collaborate with suppliers to ensure timely delivery of materials and products.
* Track and analyze key supply chain metrics and provide reports to management.
* Identify process improvements and implement strategies to increase efficiency.
* Manage and resolve any issues or disruptions in the supply chain.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams, including procurement, production, and logistics.
* Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
* Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in supply chain management.
* Maintain strong relationships with suppliers and foster a collaborative partnership.


Requirements:


* Proven experience as a Supply Chain Coordinator or in a similar role.
* Strong knowledge of supply chain management principles and practices.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficient in using supply chain management software and tools.
* Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and attention to detail.
* Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines.
* Must be a citizen or resident of the United States.


Job Type: Full-time


Benefits:


* Competitive salary
* Health insurance
* Retirement savings plan
* Paid time off

title: Equipment Distribution Coordinator (Part Time)
description:
**Equipment Distribution Coordinator (Part Time)**
--------------------------------------------------


**Job Description**


Do you enjoy working with people in a fast-paced environment? If so, consider a position as an Equipment Distribution Coordinator. Join our fast-growing U-Box department and become part of our Equipment Distribution Program and Team.

  

Equipment Distribution Coordinators use new and exciting programs to reach existing U-Haul customers with offers to participate in our Equipment Distribution program. You will manage the end-to-end process of helping orchestrate transfers of our U-Haul trailers across the continent, playing a pivotal role in the success of U-Haul and the U-Box program.

  

We are looking for friendly, customer service-oriented team members who take pride in assisting customers every day. Team members are expected to follow established methods and procedures, handle all calls expediently and efficiently, meet all quality-related metrics and goals, and act in a courteous and friendly manner while serving the customer.

 **Position details:**

* Full time and Part time positions available.
* Weekend availability is required.
* Location – U-Haul International Corporate Headquarters, work from home positions are also available.
 **This job might be for you if:**

* You enjoy helping people and problem-solving.
* You like a fast pace starting day one and staying busy every day.
* You enjoy working closely with your manager and receiving daily feedback.
* You are comfortable learning and using multiple computer programs.
 **Daily tasks** **include:**

* Interacting with field personnel via phone, email, IM chat and SMS text messages.
* Communicating with customers by making outbound calls, answering all incoming calls and via SMS text messages.
* Managing dashboards, reports and files as needed.
* Working on multiple customer records simultaneously.
 **U-Haul offers its** **Equipment** **Distribution** **Agents:**

* Train and work from home - various schedules!
* Career path available including work from home!
* Competitive hourly base.
* Opportunity for base pay merit increases based on performance.
* Part-time benefits include Medical Reimbursement Indemnity Plan, Rx Savings Plus Discount Plan, Dental Plan, Vision Plan, Retirement Savings 401(k) Plan.
 **Minimum Qualifications:**

* Basic keyboarding and computer skills.
* Ability to navigate and use multiple computer programs at once.
* Excellent verbal communication and listening skills.
* Clear speaking voice.
* General knowledge of U.S. geography.
* Willingness to incorporate feedback to constantly improve performance.
 **Training and Education Explained:**

* Fast-paced, hands-on education working with your manager from day one.
* Self-paced education at our very own U-Haul University online.
* Learn and begin performing some of your job duties with customers in the first week.
* Build on your skill set through on-the-job, continued education.
* Begin performing additional job duties with the customers and the field as you learn them.
 **Scheduling Requirements**

* The total number of hours scheduled each week will be based on business needs.
* Shifts between 8am - 5pm Arizona time.
* Part–timers must be available to work at least 25 hours a week during the winter and 32 hours during summer.
* Weekend availability required (Sundays preferred).
* Working holidays is required. We are open and customers need our help.
 *A note about how we schedule: Availability to work that aligns with the business need may increase the opportunity to be scheduled more hours**.* *We pride ourselves on being flexible with schedules, especially for students and teachers. However, if availability* *to* *work does not align with the needs of the business the result may be* *fewer* *hours scheduled.*

 **The following is** **required** **to work from home:**

* You must have a quiet, private work area.
* Dependent and child-care arrangements must be made as if you were working at a U-Haul site. This position does not allow flexibility to be on-call care for others during work hours.
* All work duties, including initial education, must be performed at your home address.
* If you want to switch or substitute computers at any time, manager approval is required in advance.
 **The following technical requirements must be met to work from home:**

* *Computer requirements and internet speeds will be verified, if interviewed.* *Additional* *requirements may apply.*
* **Computer Specifications:**
* Windows 10 or 11
* 8GB of RAM/memory or higher
* Processor must have CPU benchmark score of 2,000 or higher
* **Additional Hardware:**
* Webcam (external or built-in is ok)
* USB headset
* **Internet Speeds:**
* Ping under 100
* 10MB download speed
* 5GB upload speed
 **The following are not** **permitted** **when working from home due to compatibility, performance, security, or other concerns:**

* MAC operating systems
* Internet access through mobile wireless network, or similar. e.g. mobile hot-spot, tethering.
* Using a Proxy server or third-party network.
* Compute stick or similar device.
* Rental, rent-to-own or public computer/laptop.
* Working in a public place or using public Internet.
* Unsecure Wi-Fi / Wi-Fi not managed by the team member.
* Running non-work-related programs while working.
* Having any other anti-virus installed/in use on your computer while working other than the Company provided antivirus.
  


  

  

U-Haul is an equal opportunity employer. All applications for employment will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, provincial, state, or local law. Individual accommodations are available on requests for applicants taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Information obtained during this process will only be shared on a need to know basis.


  
### **About Us**


Since 1945, U-Haul has been serving do-it-yourself movers and their households. Like many other successful ventures, the concept for U-Haul was generated out of need. After World War II, there existed the widespread need for do-it-yourself moving equipment that would be available on a one-way, nationwide basis.


U-Haul co-founders L.S. "Sam" Shoen and his wife, Anna Mary Carty Shoen, recognized that need and acted upon it. Their visionary approach spread the cost of ownership among many users, facilitating the mobility of the populations of the U.S. and Canada. The covered wagon of the pioneers morphed into orange U-Haul trailers. In the process, an industry was born.


U-Haul Holding Company and its family of companies, including U-Haul, have strived to create a culture of health and wellness. As of February 1, 2020, and consistent with applicable law, no U-Haul Holding Company or its family of companies will hire individuals in states where it may lawfully decline to hire individuals who use nicotine products (Alabama, Alaska, Arizona, Arkansas, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Hawaii, Idaho, Iowa, Kansas, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Nebraska, Pennsylvania, Texas, Utah, Vermont, Virginia and Washington). This policy will not apply to team members hired before February 1, 2020.

title: Customer Success Coordinator
description:
***\\*\\*\\*READ ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION AND FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS PROVIDED IF YOU INTEND TO APPLY\\*\\*\\****

Drop Mobility enables sustainable, local, micro-mobility for cities. Fueled by a responsibility to tackle some of our generation’s biggest challenges around climate change and congested city infrastructure, our team works every day to replace short car trips with smaller electric vehicles, with the vision of changing the way millions of people move in cities across the world.

We build best-in-class e-bikes and customized software, offering a vertically-integrated micro-mobility sharing solution for our city and institutional partners: system design, hardware and software, ongoing support, public policy, and operations management. Unlike other micro-mobility companies, we enable our partners to locally brand and operate their systems with the belief that a more tailored approach is better for the communities we serve. We are constantly expanding our line of products including offering new ownership models to make micro-mobility more accessible to more people.

**Who we are looking for**

Drop is seeking highly motivated and capable individuals to join our Customer Success team. Responsibilities include:

* Scheduling and supporting a team of 4 or more remote Customer Success Associates
* Reviewing output of the customer success team to ensure quality standards
* Collaborating with the Customer Success Manager to develop content and internal SOPs in order to improve support processes.
* Working cross functionally with fleet and engineering teams to ensure seamless operations of micro-mobility systems
* Responding to customer inquiries via email

Our customers’ needs vary and our customer base is growing by the day, so we are looking for candidates who are well organized, dynamic and up for a challenge in a fast-evolving industry. Ideal candidates attributes include:

* Skillful written and verbal communication
* High level of organizational acumen
* Aptitude for problem solving and innovation
* Comfort working in ambiguity
* Patient and empathetic within a team environment
* Adept at content and process creation
* Passionate about the space and would enjoy working in this field

**Experience and compensation**

Ideal candidates should have:

* At least 4 years relevant customer service experience
* Familiarity with Google or Microsoft office suite of programs
* Computer and internet access required
* Experience working in shared micro-mobility a plus
* Undergraduate degree a plus

In exchange for your talents, we offer a fun and dynamic work environment with room for growth within the company and across different business verticals. This is a fully remote salaried position. The starting salary range is $48,000 to $54,000 annually depending on experience. All new hires are subject to a 90 day probationary period after which health and other company benefits are provided.

***To apply for this opportunity you must follow these steps: Email with the following subject line - “Application for Customer Success Coordinator”. Attach your resume and cover letter(optional). In the body of the email please provide 4 bullet points why you feel you are the best candidate for this role.***

Drop is a fast-growing startup with a passionate team that offers many unique experiences and opportunities for professional growth and development. If you’re excited about what we are building and think you could be a good fit for the challenge, please get in touch! We’d love to start a conversation.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Health insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Facilities Coordinator
description:
**WHO IS GALLANT?**

Gallant is a professional services organization focused on commercial construction project management and national facility maintenance. That is what we do, but that is not who we are or why we exist. We exist to help people achieve their vision. Others’ success is our success. This starts with our own people.

We care about the development of people because it is the right thing to do and also because Gallant cannot grow if the individual is not growing first. We operate with a personal and professional growth mindset. We like doing the work. We care about relationships.

When you think of the things that will truly matter the most when you are old and gray, those are the things that we focus on here at Gallant. **Serving others. Doing the right thing. Finding a way**. It’s an attitude. These are our core values.

That is who we are and that is the type of person we want to work with. If that resonates with you, please continue to read below about the specifics of the role.

**About this position:**

**If you are a passionate, skilled and client-focused Facilities Coordinator and are looking for a place where you can use your unique qualities to make a difference, we have an ideal position for you!**

The Gallant Facilities team works with elite local and national clients that seek our expertise and ability to deliver the best value at the most competitive price. Self-initiative, an excellent work ethic, and a desire to learn and grow are essential for this high energy position. Oh… and you must like a fun and cooperative environment and team!

This position will be a remote position but you are also welcome to come work out of our Crystal Lake, IL office if you are local. You will work alongside account leads and a special projects and programs team.

GALLANT Facilities Coordinators are responsible for:

* Accepting and dispatching service requests
* Coordinating schedule dates with all parties
* Confirming service completion
* Quality assurance
* Sourcing vendors
* Communication between techs and the client
* System and client updates

The ideal person for the position will:

* Have coordinator experience working in an environment where you dispatched service techs to complete work across the nation or in a geographical area.
* Be comfortable working with technology systems such as Microsoft Office Suites
* Be able to adapt to a changing environment and workload
* Grasp the challenges associated with the fast-paced commercial facilities services
* Be able to communicate with technicians and clients
* Relish in the dealing with clients and their problems
* Know how to maximize value while minimizing cost
* Be willing to roll up their sleeves to make a measurable difference
* Be comfortable communicating in e-mail and on the phone with different levels of technicians and clients
* Have a high sense of urgency and customer service mindset

**Gallant offers a strong, positive work environment, opportunity for growth and competitive wages and benefits, including:**

· Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance

· Life Insurance, short-term insurance & long-term disability insurance

· Paid Time Off with holidays

· 401(K) retirement savings plan

Job Type: Full-time

Salary Range - $45-55K Range Depending on Experience

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45,000.00 - $55,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 2 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work setting:

* Office
* Remote

Application Question(s):

* Do you have experience finding and dispatching vendors or technicians to perform repairs and maintenance and coordinating those services through completion?

Experience:

* facilities maintenance coordinating: 2 years (Required)
* vendor sourcing and management: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Enrollment Coordinator I
description:
**Waldorf University**
**Job Description**  


**Job Title:** Enrollment Coordinator I
**Department:** Online Admissions
**Reports To:** Director of Online Admissions
**FLSA Status:** Non-Exempt
**Hours:** Monday through Thursday 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM and Friday 8:00 PM to 3 PM Central Standard Time (extended hours when requested)
**Location:** Remote
**Job Summary**  


The Waldorf University Enrollment Coordinator I is responsible for providing exceptional customer service to prospective and existing students, as required. The expectation of the position is to assist prospective students with each step of the admissions process, from submitting the initial interest for admission to finalizing the first enrollment.
**Essential Job Tasks** *Additional duties may be assigned.*
* Provides clear and concise communication to prospective students by phone, e-mail, chat and text, about pertinent admission information.
* Returns any missed call, e-mail, or text, from prospective students by the appropriate communication outlet within 24-48 hours to provide answers to any potential questions.
* Secures enrollment from prospective students by assisting them over the phone or in the prospect portal by relaying necessary information pertaining to the admissions process.
* Manages and maintains working lists of prospective students by setting and keeping follow-up appointments to ensure that admissions information is relayed to prospective students in a timely manner while contributing to individual and department conversion rates. Assists with related and /or unrelated areas of the department upon need determined by the leadership team while maintaining the essential elements of the position.
* Promotes maintains and enhances workplace culture within the Admissions Department and Waldorf University.

**Qualifications**
To perform this job successfully, an individual must perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
**Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities**
**Knowledge**
* English Language - Knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar.
* Internal Processes - Knowledge of general admissions and enrollment processes.
* Clerical - Knowledge of office administrative procedures including word processing, managing files and records, typing, and other office procedures.
* Computer - Knowledge of basic computer processes including word processing, web browsing, and Microsoft Office including Basic Microsoft Excel.

**Skills**
* Critical Thinking - Uses logic and reasoning to look at different types of information in order to make conclusions and work through problems.
* Problem Solving - Gathers and analyzes information to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner.
* Communication - Provides clear and concise communication when interacting with customers, both internal and external.
* Dependability - Follows instructions, responds to management direction; Takes responsibility for own actions; Keeps commitments; Commits to long hours of work when necessary to reach goals; Completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate person with an alternate plan.
* Flexibility - Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced work environment.
* Teamwork - Balances team and individual responsibilities.

**Abilities**
* Written Comprehension - The ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing
* Written Expression - The ability to communicate information and ideas in writing so others will understand
* Oral Comprehension - The ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences
* Oral Expression - The ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand

**Education & Experience**
* Employee must have a high school diploma or equivalency (GED).
* Previous administrative or sales experience is encouraged.

**Equipment Used**
* Office equipment includes computers, telephones, printers, faxes, and copiers.
* Software used include Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, Blackboard, and internal database software
* Reliable and secure internet is required for this position.

**Work Environment**
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. The position is remote and should have an established office with secure and reliable internet. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
**Supervisory Responsibilities**
This position holds no supervisory duties.

title: Event Coordinator
description:
##### **Who We Are: The Computer Science Teachers Association (CSTA)**



Hello, World! CSTA is a non-profit membership organization that supports and promotes the teaching of computer science, providing opportunities for K–12 teachers and their students to better understand computer science and to more successfully prepare themselves to teach and learn. We are fully remote with engaged teammates spread from California to Massachusetts and we blend our collective experience gained from our past roles in non-profits, K-12 schools, higher education, and hospitality to create high-quality teaching and learning experiences for teachers worldwide.


##### **Who We Are Looking For: Meticulous Event Coordinator with Exceptional Sponsor Relationship Skills**



CSTA is looking for a relationship-driven, organized, engaging Events Coordinator to join our events team. If you are a creative problem solver, have a keen eye for detail and a passion for fostering meaningful partnerships with sponsors - we want to hear from you!

  

##### **How You’ll Contribute: Essential Duties and Responsibilities**



Each year, CSTA hosts both virtual and in-person events to support the learning and success of Computer Science Teachers. Our signature events portfolio includes virtual summits with hundreds of attendees, in person and virtual chapter leadership summits, and an annual conference that supports 2,000+ CS teachers. CSTA events are more than professional learning gatherings; they’re transformative experiences created for K-12 educators by K-12 educators who are passionate about computer science, equity, and education. Our events provide educators with opportunities to connect with like-minded professionals from all over the world, to learn from their peers, and make an impact on the future on computer science education.


As an Event Coordinator at CSTA, you will be instrumental in the success of these events by meticulously managing various aspects of event planning, with a primary focus on ensuring our sponsors have an outstanding experience and come back to sponsor year over year. In this role you’ll get an opportunity to work on events that range from intimate small group meetings focused on a key topics in the CS education space, to huge impactful moments at our annual conference.



In your day-to-day, you will:


* Oversee sponsorship and exhibitor fulfillment, ensuring that sponsor agreements are fulfilled to the highest standards.
* Cultivate and nurture relationships with sponsors and partners to understand their needs and preferences, and effectively communicate these to the team.
* Coordinate all sponsorship-related deliverables after sales have been completed, including recognition opportunities, promotional materials, and all deliverables.
* Manage swag and giveaway orders with meticulous attention to detail, ensuring branding consistency and timely delivery.
* Handle hotel room block management for event attendees, negotiating favorable rates, and providing exceptional customer service.
* Facilitate scholarship coordination to support diverse participation in our events, ensuring fairness and transparency in the selection process.
* Arrange VIP travel logistics flawlessly, from transportation to accommodations, to provide a seamless experience for our distinguished guests.
* Manage food and beverage orders for events, taking into account dietary restrictions and preferences, and ensuring a delightful culinary experience for attendees.
* Coordinate extracurricular and special gatherings at events, such as board of directors dinners, staff outings, and chapter meetups
* Manage CSTA’s presence at external events, collaborating with the Member Experience Manager to ensure all event logistics are taken care of.
* Assist in managing the events inbox with meticulous attention to detail

##### **What You Bring to the Table: Experience & Qualifications**



As our ideal candidate, you are passionate about addressing issues of equity in CS education. You have successfully managed relationships with sponsors in the past; you are calm under pressure, have an unwavering commitment to creating excellent experiences, and thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.



To be successful in this role, you also bring some combination of the following:


* Exceptional organizational and multitasking skills, with a proven ability to prioritize tasks and logistics effectively and meet deadlines.
* Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills, with a natural talent for building and maintaining relationships with sponsors and partners.
* Previous experience in event coordination or related roles is preferred but not required; however, a demonstrated ability to manage relationships with sponsors is essential.
* Familiarity with event management software and tools is a plus. At CSTA we use Cvent, ExpoGenie, RingCentral (formerly known as Hopin) and Fonteva.
* Adaptability and a proactive approach to problem-solving, with a demonstrated ability to think on your feet and find creative solutions.
* A passion for learning and a willingness to take on new challenges with enthusiasm.
* 3+ years experience in a relevant role, with a strong emphasis on attention to detail.


In addition, all candidates:


* Must be a U.S. Citizen or authorized to work in the U.S.
* Must pass a pre-employment background check
* Must be able to travel up to 25% time within the U.S. and occasionally work outside normal business hours. Travel costs are covered by CSTA.

##### **What We Offer**



As a nonprofit, we strive to be market competitive with similarly sized organizations, and internally fair in our pay practices. The hiring salary range for this role is $52,000-$56,000 annually. This represents the target offer range given the scope and experience expectations for this role.



In hiring, we are generally open to candidates in a varying range of experiences and levels, and recognize that as a candidate you may be less experienced or more senior than this job description as posted. If that's the case, an updated salary range will be shared with you if you move forward in our hiring process.



CSTA is proud to provide a flexible, engaging working environment with a great team. Other perks and benefits include:


* Flexible schedules with independent workday Fridays
* Paid time off: three weeks vacation annually, ten days sick leave, ten holidays, one-week office closure for summer break, and one-week office closure at the end of December
* Medical, dental and vision premiums paid at 100% for FT positions and subsidized dependent premiums
* Paid parental leave (8-12 weeks)
* Technology and work from home subsidy consistent with our bring-your-own-device environment
* Option to participate in retirement savings plan with generous employer match after six months of employment

##### **CSTA Leads Through Our Values**



CSTA is committed to disrupting systemic inequities and developing inclusive teaching and learning practices. This extends to our internal team and we regularly seek opportunities to expand our knowledge and better our practices to foster internal equity and a sense of belonging within our team. Read about our values here.



CSTA is honored to be an equal opportunity workplace. We realize that by bringing together a team rich in diverse backgrounds, thoughts and experiences, our people, organization, and our members flourish. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, national origin, religion, creed, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation or gender identity), age, marital status, disability, military or veteran status; or any other protected classifications or characteristics under applicable local laws.


##### **What to Expect From Us**



During the interview stage, you can expect:


* Step 1: An initial “phone” screen (30 minutes). If there’s a good mutual fit for the role, you’ll be invited to next steps in our process. If you move forward, we’ll ask you to complete a brief exercise consistent with the typical work of this role, in preparation of interviews. You can expect to spend about 60 minutes on this exercise.
* Step 2: We’ll schedule a virtual interview loop with the 3-4 team members you will work most closely with (2-3 hours total).
* Step 3: Reference checks of final candidate(s).


All interviews will be remote via Zoom; we are happy to make accommodations you might need to feel set up for success in our process.



Our Ideal Hiring Timeline:


* **Week of March 11:** "Phone" screens
* **Week of March 18:** Interview loops with the team scheduled and completed
* **March 22:** Final candidate selections made for follow up & reference checks
* **March 29:** Offer made
* **April 15** (or sooner, if possible!): Target start date for the role

title: Injury Care Coordinator (healthcare) Remote
description:
**Overview:**

As a Remote Injury Care Coordinator, you will work from your home office and be responsible for answering and gathering data from the company twenty-four-hour Injury Reporting Hotline. These individuals are responsible for gathering pertinent demographic data as well as all data related to the worker's injury. The ideal candidate must possess medical/healthcare and/or insurance knowledge, good communication skills, have a positive attitude, and work independently. Excellent listening skills are important in order that a synopsis of the conversation can be made. Candidates must have excellent written communication skills. This is not a telemarketing job and does not involve sales.

**Responsibilities:**

* Responsible for ensuring that the Injury Reporting and Provider Identification System is answered in a timely manner meeting client specifications.
* Responsible for triaging catastrophic injuries.
* Responsible for producing the First Report of Injury meeting the various client-specific and/or state-specific requirements.
* Responsible for triaging Incident Only and identifying from the first report stage, the preliminary case status of the claimant (i.e. Medical Only, Lost Time, or Lost Time-Return to Work)
* Responsible for providing referrals to applicable Preferred Provider Networks
* Responsible for having a detailed and intimate knowledge of all MCA client's specific operational procedures and products.
* Responsible for conducting Initial Assessments as needed or indicated by the client, ensuring that the assessments are completed in a timely manner meeting client-specific performance standards.
* Resolve all cases reported as problems. This will often involve direct telephone contact with MCA clients.
* Acquire and maintain knowledge and understanding of specific client needs.
* Required Assist with special projects and events.

**Qualifications:**

* Shift availability: Tuesday - Saturday (11AM - 7:30PM EST)
* U.S. Citizen
* 2+ years of healthcare, medical, insurance client services experience
* Knowledge of medical and insurance terminology preferred.
* High School Diploma, some college education preferred.
* Proficient computer skills
* Ability to prioritize workload.
* Ability to handle many varied assignments and tasks.
* Customer service-oriented experience with some decision-making responsibilities
* Strong Microsoft Office skills (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Access)
* Proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time while paying strict attention to detail.

In addition to a competitive salary, comprehensive health and welfare benefits, tuition reimbursement, and incentive compensation, this client company offers participation and vesting in a 401(k) plan with a company match.

*The information provided above has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work of the position. It is not a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required.*

Successful candidates will be required to undergo a financial and criminal background check and obtain and maintain confidential-level security clearance upon hire. We participate in the United States Federal Government E-Verify program to confirm the employment authorization of the employee upon hire.

***Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer***

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, citizenship status, color, disability, marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal state or local laws as appropriate, or upon the protected status of the person’s relatives, friends, or associates.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $35,000.00 - $45,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

* healthcare: 3 years (Preferred)
* Medical records: 3 years (Preferred)
* Medical Claims and Billing: 3 years (Preferred)
* Customer service: 3 years (Preferred)
* Computer literacy: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Project Coordinator
description:
**Company Description:**  

Clearlink Partners is an industry-leading managed care consultancy specializing in end-to-end clinical and operational management services and market expansion initiatives for Managed Medicaid, Medicare Advantage, Special Needs Plans, complex care populations, and risk-adjusted entities.  

  

We support organizations as they navigate a dynamic healthcare ecosystem by helping them manage risk, optimize healthcare spend, improve member experience, accelerate quality outcomes, and promote health equity.  

  

**Position Responsibilities:**
* Responsible for working with Program Leadership and Project Workstream leaders at a single client to help coordinate activities
* May be asked to take on progressive responsibility with experience, may eventually be asked to manage one or more small streams of project work or even small projects which would include additional responsibilities
* Work directly with the Program/Project leaders to help drive the activities required to support success
* Planning and scheduling meetings, ensuring meeting materials are developed and distributed before the meeting (meeting agenda, meeting specific content etc.)
* Ensuring meeting logistics are in place and validated (meeting rooms, phone/video/web conferencing, in room projection capabilities), and attendance for required participants is confirmed
* Taking contextual minutes during meetings and synthesizing notes post-meeting to highlight key takeaways and action items for participants.
	+ Meeting minutes will be reviewed by the Program Manager (or Workstream Leader) for approval prior to distribution to meeting participants
* Tracking and maintain a log of Key Activities (Action Items) to drive progress
* Maintenance of Program Level and Project Level Schedules
	+ May be developed and managed in various project scheduling tools including Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, Microsoft Project, or any number of other web-based project management tools
* Management of Issue and Risk Logs including intake and assessment using agreed upon management process
* Administration of Collaboration Sites for Programs and/or Workstreams
	+ Could include multiple platforms (Microsoft SharePoint, Microsoft Teams, Atlassian Jira, Atlassian Confluence, Slack or other similar tools).
	+ Items would include Program/Project documentation and administration of other data managed within the tool
	+ Includes overseeing and managing access to the collaboration site and helping to resolve any issues
* Assist Program and Workstream leadership in collecting, editing, synthesizing and distributing status updates
* Assist the Program and Workstream leadership in developing high-quality, error free presentations as needed
* Assist the Program and Workstream leadership to manage Program Governance, Financial/Budget Management, Change/Scope Management, Development/Maintenance of Program and Project Templates, Business Analysis Activities including Requirements Development, Operational Readiness Planning etc. as needed

**Position Qualifications:**  

Competencies:
* Strong demonstrable written communication skills
* Strong verbal communication skills
* An engineering mindset/strong critical thinking/problem solving skills
* Demonstrated ability to succeed through adversity (personally or professionally)
* Strong influencing skills
* Ability to work well within a team environment with varying personalities
* Quick learner with ability to take direction incorporate feedback and ask questions
* Able to enter a project mid-stream and assume delivery responsibilities within a reasonable period of time
* Comfort with being “hands-on” throughout various aspects of the project, as needed to assure delivery

Experience:
* Bachelor’s degree required or equivalent experience
* 3+ years of experience with large scale, integrated projects
* Experience with Jiva

title: Coordinator, Content
description:
THE COMPANY:


Since 1945, EBONY has celebrated and chronicled Black excellence and leadership worldwide. In January 2021, the iconic brand was relaunched under new ownership as EBONY Media Group, a diversified multi-platform media company. This is an exciting chapter for the beloved brand, and we are looking for talented, enthusiastic candidates to join our close-knit, highly collaborative team. We are calling all innovators and creators who want to be part of the legacy by helping shape EBONY’s future!


EBONY is seeking a coordinator to join the Global Content team, supporting the Executive Vice President, Content and President, EBONY Studios. Candidates must be proactive, professional, proficient in Microsoft Office, calendar management, rolling calls, project tracking, coverage, and have excellent writing skills. The ideal candidate for this role is a person who has supported a Content team or high-powered executive in the entertainment industry.


RESPONSIBILITIES (includes, but not limited to):


* Provide comprehensive administrative support to the EVP, Content & President EBONY Studios that sits across Editorial and Studios, including overseeing calendars, answering phones, scheduling departmental meetings, and documenting detailed notes during internal and external department meetings.
* Manage team meeting agenda, collecting, and setting agenda items prior to the meeting.
* Participate in department meetings.
* Maintain all Editorial and Studios shared drives.
* Coverage of books, samples, and submissions.
* Writing detailed notes on current projects and potential material.
* Tracking and logging incoming material (i.e., cuts, drafts, submissions, and samples), competitive projects, and up-and-coming talent.
* Coordinate with People Ops for vendor and freelance payments for the Content & Studios teams.
* Complete department Concur Expense Reports.
* Additional duties assigned.

REQUIREMENT:


* College degree. Related field strongly preferred.
* Minimum two years assistant experience at an agency, production company, network, or studio environment.
* Exceptional organizational and follow-thru skills.
* Positive self-starter and able to handle multiple tasks and priorities in a professional manner
* Ability to manage multiple projects in a demanding environment.
* Excellent organization and communication skills
* MAC/PC proficiency and knowledge in all Microsoft 360 Software Applications.
* Strong time management ability
* Works well within a team.
* Positive attitude

title: Project Coordinator
description:
As a Project Coordinator, you will play a crucial role in ensuring successful partner implementations and partner management. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to coordinate project activities, track progress, and facilitate communication to ensure alignment with project goals and timelines.
### **Description**

  

  

Product Implementation* Coordinate project kickoff meetings, define project scope, objectives, and deliverables.
* Develop detailed project plans, timelines, and schedules to guide project execution.
* Allocate resources, assign tasks, and monitor task completion to ensure adherence to
* project milestones and deadlines.
* Facilitate/support regular project status meetings, providing updates on progress, issues,
* and risks.
* Collaborate with product managers, developers, designers, and other stakeholders to
* clarify requirements, resolve dependencies, and address roadblocks.
* Track project expenses, monitor budget utilization, and report on financial performance.
* Maintain comprehensive project documentation, including meeting minutes, action items, and project artifacts.
* Conduct post-project reviews to evaluate outcomes, identify lessons learned, and implement process improvements.
* Support continuous improvement initiatives by contributing to the development and implementation of best practices, tools, and methodologies.

  

Qualifications* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Science, or related field.
* Proven experience as a project coordinator, implementation coordinator or similar role.
* Familiarity with project management methodologies such as Agile, Scrum, or Kanban.
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple projects concurrently, and meet deadlines.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to effectively collaborate with diverse teams and stakeholders.
* Proficiency in project management tools and software, such as JIRA, Asana, Trello, Monday.com or Microsoft Project.
* Analytical mindset with the ability to identify problems, analyze data, and develop solutions.
* Knowledge of financial services, banking, or fintech products is a plus.

  

If you are enthusiastic about managing projects in the fintech industry and want to be part of a mission-driven team, we invite you to apply and contribute to reshaping the financial well-being of individuals through Goalsetter. Join us on our journey to support users in reaching their
financial goals!

title: EPMO Governance Coordinator
description:

title: Transaction Coordinator
description:
```Job Summary```

We are seeking a detail-oriented and organized Transaction Coordinator to join our team. The Transaction Coordinator will be responsible for managing and coordinating all aspects of real estate transactions, ensuring a smooth and efficient process from start to finish. This role requires strong communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.

```Responsibilities```

- Coordinate and manage all aspects of real estate transactions, including contract preparation, communication management, compliance, and preparing for closing

- Communicate with clients, lenders, title companies, and other parties involved in the transaction to ensure timely and accurate information exchange

- Review contracts and documents for accuracy and completeness

- Maintain transaction files and ensure compliance with all applicable regulations and guidelines

- Provide exceptional customer service to clients throughout the transaction process

- Deliver exceptional 5-star customer service to all our agents

- Keep track of and oversee calendars for each real estate transaction or listing, sharing these schedules and timelines with our agents

- Monitor the progress of each transaction to ensure that deadlines are met

- Maintain regular communication with the various parties involved in the transactions, addressing any questions as they arise and providing timely status updates

- Guarantee the accuracy and completeness of all documentation

-Process all paperwork and contracts for agents promptly

- Organize and keep client files well-maintained

```Experience```

- Previous experience in a similar role as a Transaction Coordinator or in real estate administration is preferred

- Knowledge of basic math principles and proficiency in financial calculations

- Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

- Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment

- Proficiency in using computer software programs such as Microsoft Office Suite

If you are looking for an opportunity to join a dynamic team in the real estate industry, we encourage you to apply. We offer competitive compensation and opportunities for professional growth.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Operations HR & Customer Success Coordinator
description:
**Tired of working in a soulless culture where you're underappreciated? Then don't. Join the experts on PLAY.**

**You know what we like about you?**

* You've got hustle, good instincts and a compulsive urge for organization
* You have true caring for people and a passion for bringing fun to others
* You're detail-oriented. You dot the "I"s and cross the "T"s in your work
* You believe that a team of extraordinary people, in the right culture, can change the world
* You like getting your hands dirty, tackling challenges and solving problems that help the company grow. (It also doesn't hurt that you enjoy sports.)


So why use your talents where you're not appreciated or where the company cares more about the bottom line than the customer? Meanwhile, we're out here bringing people together, organizing sports leagues and fun team building events for individuals, groups and companies that want to bring their employees together.


At ZogLife, we believe life is better with real personal connections, caring communities and a sense of play. With that as our guiding light, we've built ZogSports, the nation's leading adult recreational sports company, serving six markets and tens of thousands of players every year. And now, we're looking for a **full-time Operations HR & Customer Success Coordinator** to join the ZogSports team to help us grow our leagues nationwide.

**What's the role?**


ZogSports is America's most popular adult social sports community, with operations in New York, New Jersey, DC, Los Angeles, San Francisco and San Jose. As many people return to the office or as our customers look for reasons to leave their apartments, ZogSports leagues have been relaunching at a fast pace in all of our markets. To support the growth and scaling of the business, we are hiring an **Operations HR & Customer Success Coordinator** to report to our Vice President & ZogSports General Manager.


The **Operations HR & Customer Success Coordinator** will have the ability to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment and work with a dynamic team. You will be well-supported, much appreciated, and an integrated team member from day one.


**What you'll be doing:**

* ***Field Team Hiring***- Source, hire, onboard and train field team, working directly with human resources and legal teams.
* ***Training Curriculum C******reation*** - Create a new training curriculum for field team including sports-specific and other skill training
* ***Field Team Training & Development*** - Implement the new training curriculum through a series of in-person and online trainings, which may be individual or in groups
* ***Field Team Management*** - Work closely with Field Team members, especially the Field Manager staff to focus on customer satisfaction and quality of product through ongoing training
* ***Operations*** - Work with field team and operations staff to organize equipment and logistics for league play
* ***Customer Service*** - Support customer service team with answering emails and tickets and occasionally interacting with customers to reach resolution as needed

**What else is important?**

* Ability to work from home with a typical M-F 10am-6pm schedule and occasional work from shared workspace with other team members. Also, frequent on-site visits including evenings and/or weekends

**Requirements, Skills, Knowledge and Experience**

* BA or BS degree or a minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience
* Experience with hiring and onboarding at significant volume
* Experience with indirect and/or direct people management
* Excellent organization skills and attention to detail
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills
* Ability to function efficiently in fast-paced environment
* Creative and effective problem-solving skills
* Confidence to make decisions of importance
* Exercise sound judgment
* Ability to handle multiple projects at one time and work both independently as well as within a team
* Comfortable with technology, especially Microsoft Office Suite (mainly Excel, Outlook and Word) and videoconferencing platforms (e.g., Zoom)
* Live within commuting distance of New York City

**How you will grow and learn:**


Running a business * - Learn about operating profit and making decisions in order to scale the business
* Managing people - Learn how to interview and hire A-level players, be a coach, ask great questions and give objective feedback.
Taking risks * - Learn to take calculated risks without a fear of failure

**Why should you apply to ZogLife?**

* **We care about our employees.** ZogSports makes Crain's *Best Places To Work* list for a reason. Caring is a ZogSports core value and as a result every ZogLife full-time employee currently receives:
	+ Medical insurance coverage (with possible contribution from the employee; coverage starts on 1st day of employment)
	+ Participation rights (as dictated by the plan) in ZogLife retirement plan during employment with employer profit-share contribution
	+ Unlimited Paid Time Off
	+ Paid holidays when the office is closed (11 in calendar year 2023)
	+ 2-week winter break when the office is closed
	+ Early Fridays (office closes at 2pm)
	+ Work from home stipend
	+ Learning stipend
	+ Paid parental leave
	+ Free play in ZogSports leagues

*Please note: These benefits are subject to change at any time.*

* Our culture is fun, energetic, and encourages you to be yourself and explore your potential
* This is a great gig where you'll have a ton of responsibility, flex your creativity, grow your sales and business skillsets, and have fun coming to work every day

**ZogLife Core Values:**


We expect all team members to internalize and adhere to our core values of:

**Fun:** We facilitate other people's fun and have fun making it happen

**Team Player:** Through the spirit of camaraderie, we share ideas, efforts and resources to accomplish our goals

**Caring:** We care about the company, each other and the work we do. We care about our customers, their experience and the communities in which we play

**Reliable:** We do what we say, meet our commitments and provide a consistent customer experience with relentless organization

**Own It:** We take ownership and do whatever it takes. We are go-getters who identify and creatively solve problems

**Continuous Improvement:** We are committed to getting better every day in everything we do as individuals and as a company

 **TO APPLY:**

**Please include your resume** **and** **cover letter with your application**

* Compensation for this job an annual salary of $60,000 - $65,000
* Due to the great number of resumes we receive daily, we regret that we are unable to respond individually to each person interested in our company, or answer inquiries regarding the status of a particular resume. If there is interest in interviewing you, a representative from ZogSports will contact you in the near future. Thank you for submitting your resume to ZogSports.


ZogSports is an Equal Opportunity Employer

 **More About ZogLife**


ZogLife is a family of brands including ZogSports and ZogCulture that all believe in the same WHY:

 **We believe that life is better with real personal connections, caring communities and a sense of play.**

 **We're about community**. ZogLife organizes recreational sports leagues and corporate programming to bring our WHY to participants throughout the U.S. Charity is an integral part of ZogSports' leagues, and we've donated over $3.4MM to charities selected by winning teams.

title: Medical Claims Intake Coordinator
description:
Imagine a workplace that encourages you to interpret, innovate and inspire. Our employees do just that by helping healthcare payers manage the cost of care, improve competitiveness and **inspire** positive change. You can be part of an established company with a 40-year legacy that helps our customers thrive by **interpreting** our client's needs and tailoring **innovative** healthcare cost management solutions.


Our commitment to diversity, inclusion and belonging are part of the fabric of our company. We strive to create a workplace that fosters mutual respect and collaboration, where every talent individual can participate and perform their best work. We are MultiPlan and we are where bright people come to shine!

  



Medical Claims Intake Coordinator

Remote positions available - temporary

$17.00 per hour  



Founded in 1980, MultiPlan is the industry’s most comprehensive provider of healthcare cost management solutions. We provide the most comprehensive portfolio of cost management solutions; helping payers manage the cost of care.  



We are seeking multiple temporary associates for an Intake position.
* This is a temporary position which is expected to last approximately 4 months.
* There is a possibility that this position becomes a temp to perm role.
* A 5 to 10 day training class is provided. New employees will need to work 8:00 to 4:30 pm CT during the training.
* After training, you can determine your set schedule anytime between 7:00 am and 5:00 pm CT.

* Evaluate and research cases, coordinate documentation, research claims for next steps using various systems.


* Perform timely data entry of necessary information


* Perform adjustments on medical claims


* Cross train on additional intake responsibilities and work different processes dependent upon inventory levels


* Perform written outreach to customers to obtain necessary details on medical claims


* Research appropriate systems to identify data needed to complete cases.


* Ensure compliance with HIPAA regulations and requirements.


* Demonstrate Company’s Core Competencies and values held within


* *Please note due to the exposure of PHI sensitive data – this role is considered to be a High Risk Role.*


* The position responsibilities outlined above are in no way to be construed as all encompassing. Other duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may be required and/or assigned as necessary.

  
Requirements:


* High School diploma or equivalent.
* Ability to efficiently use a keyboard and quickly navigate software applications.
* High speed internet access.
* Quiet work area without distractions.
* Regular and consistent attendance and adherence to work schedule.
* Knowledge of medical insurance terminology required.

* Communication skills (verbal, written, listening).
* Ability to work without frequent supervision.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality in all required situations.
* Ability to use software, hardware, and peripherals related to job responsibilities.


**Our commitment to diversity, inclusion and belonging are part of the fabric of our company. We strive to create a workplace that fosters mutual respect and collaboration, where every talented individual can participate and perform their best work. We are MultiPlan and we are where bright people come to shine!**

If you would like more information on your EEO rights under the law, please **click** **here**.

  



The salary range for this position is $17.00/hour. Specific offers take into account a candidate’s education, experience and skills, as well as the candidate’s work location and internal equity. This position is also eligible for health insurance and 401k.

title: Operations Coordinator
description:
