title: Patient Intake Coordinator - REMOTE
description:
The Opioid Epidemic is a public health crisis with a highly effective but underutilized clinical intervention - millions of Americans are physically dependent on Opioids but only 10% of those likely to have OUD actually access treatment. Bicycle Health addresses this gap by maximizing accessibility, affordability, and overall quality of care by enabling highly qualified clinicians to reach patients broadly and efficiently through our online platform.


The **Patient Intake Coordinator** plays an instrumental role in displaying compassion and communicating effectively with individuals currently experiencing opioid dependence. Patient Intake Coordinators guide and support incoming patients through the enrollment process and help initiate a connection with a Bicycle Health provider to receive telemedicine-based treatment.


**Location:** Remote


**Target Pay Range:** $22.50-$23.50 per hr- Compensation to be determined by the education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities of the applicant, internal equity, and alignment with market data.


**Available Schedule:**


* **Wednesday - Sunday**: W-F 12:30pm-9:00pm ET and Sat and Sun 11am-7:30 pm ET
* **Saturday - Wednesday:** Sat and Sun 11am-7:30pm ET, and Mon-Wed, 1:30pm-10 pm ET
* **Saturday - Wednesday:** Sat and Sun 11am-7:30pm ET and Mon-Wed 12pm-8:30pm ET


**Benefits:**


* 3 Weeks PTO + 8.5 days of additional sick time + 8 paid holidays (2 additional float holidays)
* 100% Employer Paid Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
* Employer Paid STD & LTD
* 401k
* $50 monthly Remote Work Stipend


**You can expect to:**


* Serve as a first point of contact for individuals interested in reducing opioid use through MAT.
* Outreach and engage with potential patients via email, SMS, phone and live chat to schedule intake calls with those interested in MAT.
* Provide a comprehensive overview of Bicycle Health's treatment model and process for enrolling in our services.
* Maintain clear and effective communication with callers, establish a positive rapport, and make accurate assessment of caller's inquiry.
* Conduct phone intakes to collect relevant health information, establish individuals' goals for treatment and determine eligibility for telemedicine-based treatment services.
* Verify insurance coverage and schedule first appointments based on provider availability.
* Register patients and document relevant clinical information within our EHR.
* Coordinate with patient's new care team to ensure a seamless transition into treatment.
* Update Bicycle Health's CRM to track patients' progress throughout the enrollment pipeline and to facilitate outreach efforts.
* Provide patients with information and referrals for community resources that may support their treatment.
* Participate in program development efforts and provide input to optimize the enrollment process.


**Skills/Experience we're looking for:**


* 1-2 years administrative experience interacting with patients in a fast-paced clinic, hospital, or community health center.
* Bilingual English/Spanish preferred.
* Previous experience working with individuals experiencing substance use dependency preferred.
* Previous experience working in a call center highly preferred.
* Experience using EHRs and CRMs is a strong plus.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Ability to quickly adapt to a demanding, evolving, and fast-paced environment.
* Proficient in using modern technology systems such as Google Sheets, Drive, Calendar.
* Ability to work on assigned holidays, typically will be required to work 2-3 holidays out of the 8 designated company holidays per year.

This is a full-time (40hrs per week) remote position.

  



#LIRemote


About Bicycle Health:



Bicycle Health is a telemedicine group that specializes in the evidence-based treatment of individuals with Opioid Use Disorder using buprenorphine. We've grown our clinical staff of medical providers caring for patients, across 32 states, and we employ a large ancillary staff for support with technologic and administrative needs, clinical and behavioral support, and care coordination. Our innovative model has achieved clinical outcomes that exceed expectations for standard-of-care in-person treatment nationally. Our mission is to increase access to high quality, affordable, convenient and confidential Opioid Use Disorder treatment for all.


*Bicycle Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law.*

title: Content and Career Pathway Coordinator
description:
**Content and Career Pathway Coordinator**

***Overview***

The National Coalition of Certification Centers (NC3) are looking for an organized and enthusiastic Content and Career Pathway Coordinator to assist in coordinating, designing, and implementing NC3’s various program curriculum plans and materials. The Content and Career Pathway Coordinator will play a crucial role in managing various curriculum development tasks, including organization and oversight of all program’s curriculum to include classroom PowerPoints, student manual, hands-on lab activities, exams, and certification templates, maintaining the curriculum on NC3certs.com, development of action plans for new curriculum in collaboration with Program Managers, and periodic review of existing curriculum. The role involves collaborating with educational institutions, industry partners, and subject matter experts to ensure the alignment of curriculum with industry standards and best practices. This is an exciting opportunity for a creative individual who is passionate about curriculum development and has a keen eye for detail. The Content and Career Pathway Coordinator will work under the guidance and in support of the organization’s Customer Success Manager.

***Responsibilities***

* Curriculum Development: Collaborate with subject matter experts to design, develop, and update curriculum resources and materials for NC3's certification programs.
* Content Review: Conduct comprehensive reviews of curriculum content to ensure accuracy, relevance, and alignment with industry standards and best practices.
* Quality Assurance: Implement quality assurance processes to maintain the highest standards of curriculum design and consistency.
* Program Coordination: Coordinate and support the implementation of curriculum resources and materials across NC3's network of educational institutions.
* Collaboration: Foster strong relationships with educational institutions and industry partners to gather feedback and incorporate industry trends into curriculum development.
* Research and Analysis: Stay cognizant of industry trends, emerging technologies, and educational practices to inform curriculum development strategies.
* Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate documentation of curriculum development processes, updates, and revisions. Generate reports on curriculum-related metrics and outcomes.
* Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing curriculum effectiveness and make recommendations for improvement based on feedback, data analysis, and emerging industry needs.

***Requirements***

* Bachelor's degree preferred
* Minimum of 3 years of experience in curriculum development, preferably in an educational or certification-focused organization.
* Strong knowledge of instructional design principles, curriculum development methodologies, and adult learning theories.
* Familiarity with industry certifications and credentialing programs.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex concepts in a clear and concise manner.
* Proficiency in using learning management systems (LMS) and instructional design software.
* Detail-oriented with exceptional organizational and project management skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and build effective relationships with stakeholders.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Passion for education and a commitment to enhancing workforce readiness.
* Periodic travel as needed
* Ability to work effectively from home office
* MS Office Proficiency to include MS publisher
* Proficiency in Adobe Acrobat

Compensation: $60,000-$65,00 Annually

W2 Position

This is a mid-entry level job for someone who experience in communications and coordination that wants grow in the position and organization.

*About NC3*

The National Coalition of Certification Centers (NC3) is an educational 501c3 non-profit network of educational institutions and industrial corporations. Together with our partners, NC3 develops and implements industry-recognized skills certifications.

In short, NC3 is where education and industry meet. We are the future model for Career and Technical Education, creating highly skilled, job-ready professionals through a network of educational partners and global industry leaders.

We were established to help build a workforce prepared to meet the needs of todays and tomorrow’s industries by connecting employers and educational institutions in synergistic partnerships that foster effective training, elevation of skilled careers, and employment opportunities.

As a small but rapidly growing non-profit organization, all NC3 employees work remotely in an agile and low-overhead work environment to most effectively carry out our mission.

*NC3 is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, ethnic or national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, disability, age (as applicable), status as a covered veteran, genetic information, and any other category protected by federal or state civil rights law.* 

*Learn more at www.nc3.net*

title: Customer Service Coordinator
description:
### **Company Overview**

Here at UKG, our purpose is people™. Our HR, payroll, and workforce management solutions help organizations unlock happier outcomes for all. And our U Krewers, who build those solutions and support our business, are talented, collaborative, and innovative problem-solvers. We strive to create a culture of belonging and an employee experience that empowers our people – both at work and at home. Our benefits show that we care about the whole you, from adoption and surrogacy assistance to tuition reimbursement and wellness programs. Our employee resource groups provide a welcoming place to land, learn, and connect with those who share your passions and interests. What are you waiting for?


### **Description & Qualifications**

Description


UKG Global Support seeks a Customer Service Coordinator that will be the liaison between our Global Support team and our customers. The successful candidate will deliver a world class customer experience, have outstanding communication skills, and exemplify a passion for assisting our customers and colleagues to promote a world class customer experience and culture.  

  

Job Responsibilities Include but not Limited to the following:  

* Answer incoming calls with enthusiasm and confidence
* Case / ticket creation and dispatch to proper queue
* Maintain high-level knowledge of extensive UKG product suite
* Confirm and/or update our customer’s contact information
* Monitor customer self-ticket creation queue
* Reach out to on-call technicians for urgent customer issues
* Adhere to standard operating procedures and policies


Assigned project work as necessary
Qualifications


Basic Qualifications:  

* Strong verbal and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to communicate effectively
* Experience in handling difficult or sensitive customer situations in a professional manner


  

Preferred Qualifications:  

* Exceptional organizational, time-management and planning skills with a strong attention to detail necessary
* Ability to provide exceptional customer service required
* Able to work with and connect with a team environment
* Ability to work overtime, weekends and holidays is preferred
### **Pay Transparency for Colorado, New York, Washington and California**

The pay range for this position in Colorado, New York, Washington and California is $30,400 to $43,650, however, base pay offered may vary depending on skills, experience, job-related knowledge and location. This position is also eligible for a short-term incentive and a long-term incentive as part of total compensation.

Information about UKG’s comprehensive benefits can be reviewed on our careers site at https://www.ukg.com/careers.
San Francisco Bay Area Pay Law


There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area, the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $34,960 to $50,198 per year.
### **EEO Statement**

**Equal Opportunity Employer**


Ultimate Kronos Group is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive considerations for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, genetic information, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, veteran status, and any other legally protected status under federal, state, or local anti-discrimination laws.

title: Billing & Contracts Coordinator
description:
Job Summary:

Employee is responsible for assisting the Billing Specialist with all billing related matters including, but not limited to creating and sending group client invoices, making crucial updates to invoices upon request and assisting clients with billing related questions. This role is an important role as payments are dependent on the accuracy of the invoices sent to clients. Employee is also responsible for reviewing and processing standard contracts and customer orders under the supervision of the Manager. This aspect of the role is also important as revenue depends on the prompt and accurate processing of group customer contracts and orders.

Key Responsibilities

* Assists the Billing Specialist with invoice processing, reviewing all pertinent documents related to orders so that accurate invoices can be created and sent to clients.
* Creates invoices and sends them to clients via email using Salesforce system, and via online AP systems based on client needs.
* Corrects any errors and discrepancies on invoices, including sending balance due invoices if needed.
* Updates billing addresses and invoicing contact info as needed.
* Handles phone calls or questions from clients or co-workers related to billing.
* Works closely with Accounts Receivable to ensure our invoice records are accurate.
* Handles billing cases from clients (internal and external).
* Responsible for documenting invoicing portal work instructions to ensure that invoice portals are thoroughly documented and to serve as a backup to the Billing Specialist on the invoicing portals.
* Assists with order processing on an as needed basis, reviewing agreements and supporting documentation related to opportunities/quotes so that accurate orders can be processed.
* Follows up with clients to track down POs needed to properly invoice clients.
* Assists with Contracting as needed, sending, and reviewing standard contracts to clients under the supervision of the Manager.
* Completes vendor-related forms for clients upon request.
* Completes refund requests for clients upon request.
* Reviews client tax exemption certificates and processes exemption status in Salesforce system.
* Other projects and tasks as assigned by Manager.

Requirements

* Strong attention to detail
* Prior invoicing or billing experience (preferred but not required)
* Ability to effectively multi-task
* Excellent communication skills
* Critical thinking skills
* Proficiency in math and reasoning
* Intuitive interpersonal skills

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $24.00 - $26.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Project Coordinator
description:
Conversant Group is an IT infrastructure and security consulting company founded in 2009 and based in Chattanooga, TN. We are the **world’s first Civilian Cybersecurity Force**, dedicated to defeating cyber terrorists. To do so, Conversant Group is organized into three battalions: ***Athena7***which provides infrastructure assessment, strategy and remediation, ***Grypho5***which offers ongoing managed protection, and ***Fenix24***which provides rapid restoration in case of a cyberattack.  

Fenix24 is a mission-driven team, and the industry-leading Disaster Recovery and Restoration service. We operate with the speed and efficiency of a military special operations team to combat Threat Actors across the globe. More than work, it is a calling. When a ransomware event occurs, we understand that the impact is often more than just business interruption. In many cases, lives and livelihoods are at stake. From hospitals to critical infrastructure, we are the first responders and are on-call 24/7.  

We are searching for a motivated Logistics Specialist to join our Fenix24 team. In this role, you will be responsible for supporting leadership and engineering team in a fast-paced restoration environment. You will be providing program support on the day-to-day engagements across the division by through client updates, internal team updates and coordinating the team efforts across key projects.
### **Responsibilities**

* Support Technical Captains & Cell Majors in organizing and documenting engagements & restoration workstreams. Including estimations of time to completion, engagement budgets, and staffing.
* Schedule and attend scoping calls taking notes and provide initial access and other applicable documentation.
* Schedule and manage client-facing collaboration rooms and monitor internal and external communications with clients, counsel, and digital forensic partners (via Teams, Slack, Signal etc).
* Support Technical Captains & Cell Majors in providing documentation (slide shows, bullet points) for update calls for clients, counsel and insurance carriers as needed.
* Work with engineers daily to insure workstreams are properly documented, engagement tracking, and time sheets are entered.
* Build & organize team & engagement on-call rotations in accordance with our time off schedule, to assure full coverage of restoration workstreams.
* Communicate and coordinate with stakeholders for budget & Fenix24 internal/external staffing needs.
* Develop standardized reporting metrics for utilization and staff production.
* Create internal documentation for process improvement and after-action reports.
* Other duties as required.

### **Qualifications, Requirements & Preferred Skills**

* Entry level project management qualifications.
* Entry level, or any prior IT knowledge is desirable.
* Proficiency within Microsoft Office applications required (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
* Proficiency with external communications and collaboration tools (MS Teams, Sharepoint, Webex, Zoom, Slack, Signal).
* Working knowledge of time and billing management software.
* Current working knowledge of IT / IR strongly preferred.
* Excellent analytical, organization, and problem-solving skills.
* Demonstrated strong written and oral communication skills, including strong relationship building skills and leadership capabilities.
* Ability to form relationships across all levels of the company while modeling Conversant’s Culture and Values.

### **Core Values & Competencies**

* Mission-driven
* Self-Starter
* Able to work remotely in a fast-paced environment.
* Adaptable
* Teamwork

**Why work for us?**  

We offer a dynamic, innovative work environment with rewarding work - help save our clients from disaster!
We truly value our employees and provide an extraordinary package to prove it, including:  

  

Internal and external learning & development opportunities, including career advancement.
Competitive compensation & benefits.
Scheduled & flexible PTO programs.
Fully remote work options.
Family friendly programs
Care packages
Regular team building events.  

Join the world's first Civilian Cybersecurity Force and take your career to the next level!

title: Project Coordinator
description:
Job Description
Job Description
As Project Coordinator on the Instructional Design and Development team at Chegg Skills, you will play a crucial tactical role supporting the team’s ever-growing pipeline of programs and ensuring we’re delivering on our project commitments. You will be a key contributor to the Content Ops team within the broader ID&D team, working as the team’s primary boots-on-the-ground liaison. You’ll work deep in the weeds of each project, ensuring that tasks, tickets, and deliverables are being completed and passed off, communicating updates to relevant stakeholders within the team, and keeping everyone on track to meet both incremental and overarching milestones.
This role requires a tricky balance – you must be comfortable being a deadline-driven task master while creating and sustaining a deep trust within the team. You must be able to work confidently in a highly visible role in an async/remote capacity – in other words, you must be able to track people down in order to push the work forward. And finally, you must be able to communicate clearly and effectively, particularly in writing. You will regularly compose clear, concise updates, ask relevant and targeted questions, and make specific requests in Jira, Slack, or elsewhere.
The Project Coordinator will be instrumental in helping us reach our content delivery goals. This will start as a 6-month contract with high likelihood of extension and conceivably future growth.
Responsibilities  

* Day-to-day tactical coordination to support the instructional design team’s ever-growing development pipeline
* Proactive and targeted tracking of deliverables, tickets, tasks, and due dates across our phases of curriculum development; a superuser of our suite of project management and collaboration tools (Jira, Confluence, Slack, MS suite)
* Specific on-the-ground support for new program development, particularly for those programs that have clear and established workflows; may involve running or supporting regular meetings or syncs
* Monitoring explicit hand-offs of materials and tickets between team members and ensuring smooth and timely transitions between phases of development, particularly between instructional designers, SMEs, members of the Content Ops team, and editors/QA specialists/content producers
* Managing curriculum bug intake and triage process; audit and flag possible improvements this process to ensure we’re supporting cross-functional teams and students
* Supporting media production processes, including art log management, video pre-production timelines, and the hand-off of media artifacts
* Providing regular updates on new program development progress to project manager and other stakeholders
* Planning and setting up meetings, creating program documentation, and organizing project logistics
* Uploading Jira tickets, managing certain predictable or regular async comms across the team, and providing other project management support as it arises
* Support Content Operations team on process changes; identify pain points and problems inhibiting efficient or quality content production or maintenance
* As needed, collaborate with the Content Ops team and instructional designers understand and prioritize curriculum updates – helping determine the scope of changes, set realistic dates for curriculum release, and manage the completion of editorial, QA, and publishing tasks to meet deadlines


Requirements* 3+ years of experience in a project coordinator, project manager, or digital content production role (or adjacent or similar title/position).
* Familiarity with and comfort with project management software; nice-to-have: experience with Jira/Confluence specifically.
* A nice-to-have: experience working in curriculum design, edtech, education, tech bootcamp, or similar tech or tech-adjacent space.
* Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and handle multiple projects simultaneously.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, particularly in writing.
* Exceptional time-management and organizational skills, and strong attention to detail.
* Ability to adapt to evolving industry standards and technologies.
* Flexible hours to accommodate varying workloads.

  

Why do we exist?
Students are working harder than ever before to stabilize their future. Our recent research study called State of the Student shows that nearly 3 out of 4 students are working to support themselves through college and 1 in 3 students feel pressure to spend more than they can afford. We founded our business on provided affordable textbook rental options to address these issues. Since then, we’ve expanded our offerings to supplement many facets of higher educational learning through Chegg Study, Chegg Math, Chegg Writing, Chegg Internships, Thinkful Online Learning, and more to support students beyond their college experience. These offerings lower financial concerns for students by modernizing their learning experience. We exist so students everywhere have a smarter, faster, more affordable way to student.
Video Shorts
Life at Chegg: http://youtu.be/Fwf90zgaOLA
Certified Great Place to Work!: http://reviews.greatplacetowork.com/chegg
Chegg Corporate Career Page: https://jobs.chegg.com/
Chegg India: http://www.cheggindia.com/
Chegg Israel: http://www.chegg.com/about/working-at-chegg/israel/
Thinkful (a Chegg Online Learning Service): https://www.thinkful.com/about/#careers  

  

Chegg out our culture and benefits!
http://www.chegg.com/about/working-at-chegg/benefits/

title: Special Projects Coordinator
description:
**Two Six Technologies: Information Advantage**



Two Six Technologies is looking for a self-motivated individual to be an extension of the Information Advantage executive team to help drive initiatives and provide support through rapid growth. This business unit provides Information Advantage to Government, Military and Fortune 50 customers tasked with mission critical decision making. You will be working in a fast-paced, tech-focused, product-based environment and be required to handle a broad range of internal operational and organizational needs. The position offers an opportunity to learn the ropes of running and growing a business. This position allows for remote work, but there is a preference for candidates who can work a few days a week at the Arlington, VA Headquarters.


**Responsibilities Include:**


* Working with the SVP and VP of the Information Advantage business unit to prioritize, plan and deliver on business unit initiatives, projects, and priorities. Supporting other leaders in the business unit as needed.
* Serving as an internal analyst, coordinator and project manager to ensure various projects and initiatives are moving forward
* Breaking down problems into actionable solutions, mediating disputes, and dealing with operational issues before they are brought to the attention of executives
* Leading our internal communications, including anticipating what needs to be communicated, amplifying corporate communications, supporting monthly all hands, and composing weekly comms to the workforce.
* Providing contract support, including customer and process management and preparing strategy and documentation for pricing and pricing justification.
* Developing a system metrics dashboard that allows you to stay organized while juggling several projects, stakeholders, and priorities at once
* Performing administrative tasks, such as complex calendar scheduling, deconflicting competing priorities, preparing meeting materials and reports, coordinating travel arrangements, arranging all associated logistics for internal and external business meetings and conferences.


**Minimum Qualifications:**


* Excellent verbal, written, and visual communications skills
* Detail-oriented, technically adept, resourceful, and agile to constantly changing demands and priorities.
* Possess analytical skills and the ability to quickly process and synthesize disparate information
* Demonstrated ability to be discrete and handle sensitive information
* Outstanding organizational and time management skills
* Bias for action
* Experience as an Executive Admin, Operations Coordinator, Corporate Communications Director, or similar role
* Two years of experience with Google Suite, Slack, Zoom, Microsoft Office Suite


**Nice If You Have:**


* Interest in supporting US government missions to counter foreign adversary and non-state actor propaganda and disinformation
* Demonstrated interest and/or experience in emerging technologies, entrepreneurship, and/or product
* Experience identifying and creating efficiencies to drive projects and initiatives to meet desired objectives and outcomes
* Experience building rapport and collaborating with leaders and colleagues across the business and keep executives accountable with tact and grace
* Experience working for a Government contracting firm
* Experience with meeting/event planning, and task management
* Bachelor's degree and/or Master's degree
* Ability to work on-site a few days a week at Arlington Headquarters


**Clearance Requirements**


* The candidate must be able to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret Clearance

title: Coordinator - Transitions & Authorization Resolution
description:
Overview:

As a Coordinator- Transitions & Authorization Resolution, you will serve as a first point of contact for patients needing home healthcare services. You will be responsible for receiving and responding to incoming calls from providers, referral sources and potential patients by collecting and entering clinical and demographic information into our CareCentrix portal. You will assist and complete activities related to transition function that include but are not limited to; Patient Registration, Eligibility/Benefit Verification, and Staffing coordination while also participating in special projects working under general direction.  


Responsibilities:
* Assists Transition department leadership in all assigned activities specific to the Member Transition Process for all new client installs and new groups to existing clients.
* A key contributor to Trans App testing, insuring all aspects of the application meets expectations prior to any go-live transition activities.
* Successfully fulfills work assignments with accuracy and timeliness on a day to day basis for activities related to member transitions; to ensure member, provider and health plan satisfaction.
* Communicates with applicable leaders any barriers to transition activities and partners with team members to ensure successful transition activities are maintained.
* Assists and completes activities related to transition function that include but are not limited to; Patient Registration, Eligibility/Benefit Verification, and Staffing coordination.


Qualifications:
* Requires a HS diploma or equivalent; up to 1 year of previous related experience; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.
* Two to five years' experience in the managed healthcare service industry, with a focus on client management, customer service, and operations.
* Good knowledge of the insurance/managed care/reimbursement and customer service industry is required.
* This position requires the ability to function in a fast paced environment with high volume work output, ability to multi-task and prioritize work load to meet client needs is critical.
* Excellent communication (verbal/written), problem resolution, and interpersonal skills are essential.
* Must be detail oriented, be responsive, and demonstrate independent thought and critical thinking.
* Must be able to successfully work from home where appropriate and needed.

**What we offer:*** **Starting Pay for external hires is $17.50/ per hour + Monthly Incentive Bonus Opportunity.** The pay range included in this posting reflects future growth / earning potential.
* Full range of benefits including Health, Dental and Vision with HSA Employer Contributions and Dependent Care FSA Employer Match
* Generous PTO, 401K Savings Plan, Paid Parental Leave, free on-demand Virtual Fitness Training and more

CareCentrix maintains a drug-free workplace

title: Provider Relations Coordinator I (8:30am-5:00pm Pacific Time M-F)
description:
Job Summary:

The Provider Relations Coordinator I will be responsible for maintaining and developing relations with medical clinics across the country and internationally, to ensure that our clients’ occupational healthcare needs are met. The Coordinator I will respond to client inquiries and ensure that they are serviced in a timely fashion and apply knowledge of our Occupation Health Medical Programs.
Responsibilities:
* Providing superior customer service by responding to client inquiring about our providers/clinics.
* Training and development of new hires, as needed
* One-time clinic set-up
* Mobile clinic on-site coordination
* Demonstrating knowledge of client requirements and our clinic providers’ services
* Educating clinics and medical providers regarding client requirements
* Entering customer information accurately into multiple databases
* Research new clinic location across the US and internationally, based on client
* Perform additional duties and assume additional responsibilities as identified by manager for the efficient operation of WorkCare.


Qualifications:
* **Education and Experience**
	+ High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
	+ At least 1 year experience of Provider Network Coordinator I job duties.
	+ Experience in delivering client focused solutions.
	+ Experience in healthcare is a plus.
* **Skills and Competencies**
	+ Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills; strong telephonic skills.
	+ Must be able to demonstrate the ability of maintaining privacy and confidentiality.
	+ Strong critical thinking skills; problem solving, and decision making.
	+ Must have the ability to gather data, compile information and prepare reports.
	+ Ability to manage multiple priorities, with attention to detail and accuracy.
	+ Ability to create and edit written materials.
	+ Ability to communicate effectively to a variety of audiences.
	+ Skill in organizing resources and establishing priorities.
	+ Demonstrate cooperative behavior with colleagues, supervisors and clients.
	+ Strong time management, organizational, and follow-through skills.
	+ Ability to meet and exceed daily and weekly individual performance goals.
	+ Ability to work independently as well as assisting other team members when needed.
	+ Requires regular and predictable attendance and punctuality.
* **Computer Skills**
	+ Must be competent in the Windows operating system environment, Adobe Professional, Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint) and learn other software as needed.
* **Physical Demands**
	+ Requires sitting for long periods of time, working at a desk.
	+ Some bending and stretching could be required.
	+ Working under stress and use of computer/phone required.
	+ Manual dexterity required for use of computer keyboard.
	+ Occasionally may be required to stand, walk, stoop, kneel and/or crouch.
	+ May occasionally lift and/or move up to 15 pounds.
* **Work Environment**
	+ Work Environment must be free from background noise and distraction, noise level is acceptable, temperature is controlled.
	+ At home set up must meet all Company IT, privacy and safety requirements.

Additional Job Information: This is a full-time remote position. Candidates must reside in the United States and be authorized to work lawfully in the United States for any employer. The work schedule is Monday-Friday 11:30am-8:00pm Eastern Time (8:30am-5:00pm Pacific Time). Candidates can be located in any US time zone as long as they can work the required hours. The salary for this position is $16.00 per hour. Benefits for this position include paid time off; medical, dental, vision, and critical illness insurance; HSA, HRA, and FSA; life and disability insurance; EAP; 401K; legal and identity theft coverage; pet insurance and more. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other classification protected by applicable laws. WorkCare is committed to providing access, equal opportunity, and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment. About WorkCare:

WorkCare, Inc., is a U.S.-based, physician-directed occupational health company with global outreach.  

Our mission is Protecting and Promoting Employee Health…from Hire to Retire. We believe Work Matters. Health Counts. Prevention Saves.  

Our occupational clinicians and industry subject matter experts deliver integrated, total worker health solutions to employers in all types of industries. Our capabilities include Medical Exams & Travel program management; 24/7 Incident Intervention telehealth triage; Onsite Services & Clinics; Consulting Medical Directors; Clinical Accommodation and Leave Management support; and a full suite of COVID-19 interventions. Our Industrial Athlete and Bio-ergonomic Surveillance programs are designed to prevent and manage work-related strains and sprains.  

Visit www.workcare.com to learn more.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
### **About the Role:**


As a Marketing Coordinator at Acadia, you will play a pivotal role in amplifying our agency’s presence and offerings across digital, social, and in-person channels. This position offers the unique opportunity to work closely with our Marketing Director to bring innovative ideas to life, leveraging a comprehensive marketing tech stack to make a measurable impact on our brand's visibility and lead generation efforts.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Marketing content Implementation: You will be instrumental in executing our content strategy across multiple digital platforms. This includes crafting compelling email newsletters, managing website content, and maintaining an active and engaging presence on social media platforms. Your work will directly contribute to maintaining and growing Acadia as a thought leader in the industry.
* Project Management and Collaboration: Utilizing tools like Asana, you'll coordinate the creation and dissemination of marketing materials, from newsletters to podcasts. You'll work in concert with content creators, designers, and technology vendors to ensure seamless execution of marketing initiatives.
* Design and Content Creation: With access to templates in Canva, Photoshop, and HubSpot, you will create visually appealing social posts, marketing materials, and oversee the email marketing campaigns. Your creative skills will enhance our brand's consistency and ensure our messaging resonates with our target audience.
* Business Development Support: Leveraging tools such as Zoominfo, you'll help identify and track potential leads, providing crucial support to our business development efforts. Your role is critical in bridging marketing efforts with tangible business opportunities.

**Objectives of the Role:**

* Collaborate with internal teams to uncover insights and strategies, developing and implementing comprehensive marketing and branding strategies for both new and existing services.
* Execute a content strategy that not only highlights Acadia’s expertise but also engages our target audience effectively, enhancing our market positioning and brand recognition.
* Support the Marketing Director and senior leadership in promoting Acadia’s achievements and milestones, ensuring our successes are widely recognized and celebrated.


This role is designed for a dynamic, marketing-savvy professional who thrives in a collaborative environment and is passionate about driving growth through effective marketing and branding strategies. Your efforts will directly influence Acadia's market position and contribute to our overall success.

**Skills required:**

* Hubspot
* Canva
* Photoshop
* Fivver
* HeyOrca or similar social sharing platform
* Audacity
* Castmagic
* Wordpress
* Libsyn
* Castmagic
* Go To Meeting

**Contract duration:**

* 5 months with possible extension

**Here’s how we live our values at Acadia**

* Can-do: We dedicate ourselves to helping our clients and co-workers reach their fullest potential. We demonstrate courage and urgency to find and take ownership.
* Curiosity: We show genuine interest. We are the first to ask why, the first to research, and the first to understand. We ask questions until we find the path to conquer obstacles and build solutions
* Candor: We are honest and transparent in all our actions. We strive to foster positive and mutually beneficial relationships where respect and humanity thrive.
* Community: We will make lives better for those people, clients, and other deserving causes that we care deeply about.

title: Personnel and Schedule Coordinator
description:
Personnel Coordinator

Cahill Swift seeks to hire a highly organized individual to assist with the coordination of personnel scheduling and information management.

The candidate selected will be in charge of tracking all project schedules/calendars for a team of 20 individuals. This will consist of creating and keeping current, a calendar and monitoring events and tasks, communicating schedules to the team members, and reporting progress and status to managers.

The role will also involve sending reminders to team members as tasks come due and as relevant information is received from clients.The role will also include monitoring and managing shared files for organization and consistency, including creating templates, etc.

The firm is open to fully remote work, with possible travel to the Boston office if needed. Travel opportunities are also available for the candidate if mutually desired.

Qualifications: Candidate must be exceptionally organized with clear communication skills. Usage of Gantt charts, knowledge of Microsoft Project and Excel is preferred. Phone and online meeting platforms will occasionally be necessary, but will not constitute the majority of the work.

We anticipate beginning as part-time and potentially increasing.

Please send a resume or detailed past work experience and descriptions.

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $20.00 - $24.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 30 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Work Location: Remote

title: Membership Coordinator
description:
**Membership Coordinator**

***Overview***

The National Coalition of Certification Centers (NC3) is looking for an organized and enthusiastic Membership Coordinator to assist in coordinating, designing and implementing NC3’s membership strategy and engagement. The Membership Coordinator will play a crucial role in supporting the Executive Project and Membership Manager and Director of Development in growing and retaining our membership base. You will be responsible for coordinating various activities related to membership engagement, recruitment, and retention. The role involves collaborating with educational institutions, industry partners, and internal team members to ensure the alignment of membership strategies. This is an exciting opportunity for an extroverted individual who is passionate about supporting a network of institutions across the nation and has a keen eye for detail. The Membership Coordinator will work under the guidance and in support of the organization’s Executive Project and Membership Manager and Director of Development.

**Responsibilities**

**Membership Support:**

* Assist in the development and implementation of strategies to attract and retain members.
* Respond to member inquiries and provide excellent customer service.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date membership records and database.

**Communication:**

* Collaborate with the Executive Project and Membership Manager and Marketing Coordinator to create engaging content for newsletters, emails, and other communication channels.
* Oversee communication calendar to ensure timely and effective communication with members regarding events, updates, and opportunities.

**Event Coordination:**

* Assist in planning and executing events, including conferences, webinars, and member meetings.
* Assist with organizing needed signage for events and NC3 institutions.

**Collaboration:**

* Work closely with other departments to align membership activities with overall organizational goals.
* Collaborate with marketing and outreach teams to promote membership benefits.

**Data Management:**

* Compile and analyze membership data to identify trends and opportunities for growth.
* Generate reports for the Executive Project and Membership Manager to assess the effectiveness of membership strategies.

***Requirements***

* Bachelor's degree preferred
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in membership coordination or similar role, preferably in an educational focused organization.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex concepts in a clear and concise manner.
* Detail-oriented with exceptional organizational and project management skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and build effective relationships with stakeholders.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Passion for education and a commitment to enhancing workforce readiness.
* Periodic travel as needed
* Ability to work effectively from home office
* Proficiency in email marketing platforms such as Constant Contact or Mail Chimp
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Proficiency
* Proficiency in Adobe Acrobat

**Compensation**: $50,000 per year

W2 Position

Benefits Available

This is a mid-entry level job for someone who experience in communications and coordination that wants grow in the position and organization.

***About NC3***

The National Coalition of Certification Centers (NC3) is an educational 501c3 non-profit network of educational institutions and industrial corporations. Together with our partners, NC3 develops and implements industry-recognized skills certifications.

In short, NC3 is where education and industry meet. We are the future model for Career and Technical Education, creating highly skilled, job-ready professionals through a network of educational partners and global industry leaders.

We were established to help build a workforce prepared to meet the needs of todays and tomorrow’s industries by connecting employers and educational institutions in synergistic partnerships that foster effective training, elevation of skilled careers, and employment opportunities.

As a small but rapidly growing non-profit organization, all NC3 employees work remotely in an agile and low-overhead work environment to most effectively carry out our mission.

*NC3 is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, ethnic or national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, disability, age (as applicable), status as a covered veteran, genetic information, and any other category protected by federal or state civil rights law.* 

*Learn more at www.nc3.net*

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* Please complete a Meyers Briggs Personality Test at www.16personalities.com and post your results in the text box.

Work Location: Remote

title: Project Coordinator
Records Coordinator
description:
**Waldorf University**
Job Description
**Job Title:** Records Coordinator  

**Department:** Registrar  

**Reports to:** Registrar  

**FLSA:** Non-Exempt  

**Hours:** Monday through Thursday 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM , Friday 8:00 AM to 3:00 PM CST
**Location**: Remote
  

**Job Summary**
The records coordinator position is responsible for accuracy and maintenance of all student records in compliance with State and Federal law, including FERPA, while providing reliable academic and policy-driven service to students, faculty and staff. Researches policy to provide sound decisions and definitive judgments in keeping with standard record keeping practices. Coordinates all administrative support to academic programs via student requests. Accountable for all official correspondence on behalf of the Registrar. Streamlined and efficient stewardship of University resources.
**Essential Job Tasks**
* Examines transcripts to determine eligibility for admission to the University
* Stores transcripts and forms electronically
* Prepares and mails official transcripts and University letters
* Prepares student records for the admissions and readmissions committees
* Phone Rotation and Live Chat as assigned

**Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities**
**Knowledge*** English Language - Knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar.
* Academic Processes – Knowledge of university guidelines, course descriptions, and academic terminology.
* Clerical – Knowledge of office administrative procedures including word processing, managing files and records, typing, and other office procedures.
* Computer – Knowledge of basic computer processes including word processing, web browsing, and Microsoft Office including Basic Microsoft Excel.
* Mathematics – Knowledge of basic mathematics.

**Skills**
* Critical Thinking – Uses logic and reasoning to look at different types of information in order to make conclusions and work through problems.
* Reading Comprehension - Understanding written sentences and paragraphs in work related documents.
* Research – Locates key facts and information in order to learn more about different types of information.
* Interpersonal Skills – communicates and interacts with people effectively while being aware of social perceptions.
* Time Management – Manages one’s own time to accomplish assigned tasks.
* Attention to Detail – Thoroughness and accuracy when accomplishing a task ensuring all aspects are reviewed.

**Abilities**
* Written Comprehension -The ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing.
* Written Expression - The ability to communicate information and ideas in writing so others will understand.
* Oral Comprehension - The ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences.
* Oral Expression - The ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.
* Selective Attention (Vigilance) - The ability to concentrate on a task over a period of time without being distracted.

**Qualifications**
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
**Education & Experience**
Requires a high school diploma.
**Equipment Used**
* Office equipment including computers, telephones, printers, faxes, and copiers.
* Software used includes Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, Blackboard, and internal database software.
* Reliable and secure internet is required for this position.


**Work Environment**
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. The position is remote and should have an established office with secure and reliable internet. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
**Supervisory Responsibilities**
There are no supervisory responsibilities for this position.

title: Supply Chain Coordinator (contract)
description:
**Supply Chain Planner (Contract)**

 *Please note that this is a contract role providing services to Microsoft through external staffing partners of Allegis Global Solutions. If you are selected for this role, you will be employed by AGS and will not be an employee of Microsoft.*

 **Summary:**

The main function of a Supply Chain Planner is to extract, triangulate, and analyze demand and supply data from multiple sources. Based on the analysis, the Supply Chain Planner will compile and create reports/metrics using Power BI to communicate and deliver findings. Supply Chain Planner will coordinate and collaborate with stakeholders to address and reconcile any data gaps/issues and document any changes and/or call outs where action/help is needed.

 **Job Responsibilities:**

* Compile weekly demand/supply data.
* Analyze demand/supply data to identify any shortage or excess.
* Triangulate and reconcile data.
* Create and maintain data reporting/metrics using visualize data in Power BI.
* Building Power BI by extracting data from multiple databases using SQL.
* Run "what if" scenario models using Excel or other tools.
* Setup/coordinate discussions and reviews with stakeholders.
* Document meeting minutes and action items and follow up with owners for closure.
* Identify and document process or tool improvements.
* Ability to accommodate a flexible work schedule.

 **Requirements:**

* 5-7 years Supply Chain experience required.
* High school diploma or GED required.
* Proficient with MS Excel, Pivot tables, Power Pivot, Power Point, Power BI, and SQL.
* Verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail, problem solving and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work in a fast pace environment and adapt to changes quickly.
* Ability to accommodate a flexible work schedule.

 **Additional Details:**

* Location: Remote
* Duration: 4 months
* Pay Range: $35.50 - 40 per hour

 *AGS is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer (M/F/Disability/Veterans). We will consider all applications without regard to race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable law.*

title: Portal Support Coordinator
description:
**About Us**

All Care To You is a Management Service Organization providing our clients with healthcare administrative support. We provide services to Independent Physician Associations, TPAs, and Fiscal Intermediary clients. ACTY is a modern growing company which encourages diverse perspectives. We celebrate curiosity, initiative, drive and a passion for making a difference. We support a culture focused on teamwork, support, and inclusion. ACTY offers 100% employer paid medical, vision, dental, and life coverage for our employees. We also offer paid holiday, sick time, and vacation time as well as a 401k plan. Additional employee paid coverage options available.

**Job purpose**

The Portal Support Coordinator is responsible for supporting and maintaining All Care To You’s portal servicing, provider, provider offices, members, as well as others as needed. This position will answer all incoming portal customer service calls providing excellent customer service. This position will work with health care claims, authorizations, referrals, provider contracts, healthcare databases, and provider overall administrative support. This role involves facilitating communication between various departments, troubleshooting technical issues, and ensuring smooth operation of the portal to enhance user experience and efficiency. This position is ideal for someone who is a strong communicator and team player.

**Duties and responsibilities**

· **User Support**: Provide technical support to users experiencing issues with the portal, including login problems, navigation assistance, and troubleshooting errors.

· **Training and Documentation**: Develop and maintain training materials and documentation to assist users in utilizing the portal effectively.

o Facilitate provider onboarding trainings and readiness assessment meetings.

· **Collaboration**: Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, implement changes, and address issues related to the portal system.

· **Quality Assurance**: Conduct regular audits of the portal system to identify and address any bugs, errors, or inconsistencies.

· **Performance Monitoring**: Monitor portal performance metrics and user feedback to identify areas for improvement and implement enhancements.

· **Security Compliance**: Ensure that the portal system adheres to security standards and protocols to protect sensitive information and prevent unauthorized access.

· **Vendor Management**: Liaise with external vendors and service providers to resolve technical issues and implement updates or upgrades to the portal system.

· **Continuous Improvement**: Identify opportunities to streamline processes, improve usability, and enhance functionality to optimize the portal experience for users.

· **Project Coordination**: Assist in the planning, implementation, and management of portal-related projects, including upgrades, migrations, and integrations.

· Provider and Vendor data entry adds, changes and updates.

· Eligibility verification and system updates.

· Health plan Annual Wellness form submission and/or review.

· Other duties as needed.

**Qualifications** 

· 1 year healthcare experience required

· 1 year customer service experience

· Proficiency using Outlook, Microsoft Teams, Zoom, Microsoft Office (including Word and Excel) and Adobe

· Detail oriented and highly organized

· Strong ability to multi-task, project management, and work in a fast-paced environment

· Strong ability in problem-solving

· Ability to self-manage, strong time management skills

· Ability to work in an extremely confidential environment

· Strong written and verbal communication skills

**Education and Additional Requirements** 

· Bachelor’s Degree (or in progress) in Business Administration or Healthcare Administration preferred; experience considered in lieu of degree

**Working conditions**

· This job may require flexible work hours due to the nature of the responsibilities

· Candidate must be comfortable with ambiguity and open to working in a collaborate environment

**Physical requirements**

· Sitting/standing for extended periods of time.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $24.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Customer service: 1 year (Preferred)
* Healthcare Administration: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Human Dimensions Program Coordinator
description:
**OFFICE LOCATION**
-------------------

  


#Li-remote


#PDN


#Open until filled

  

This position may be based in any country where TNC has an established entity and the ability to work within the NA region time zones taking into consideration legal restrictions, such as non-national ratios and immigration processing times.


**WHO WE ARE**
--------------

  


The mission of The Nature Conservancy (TNC) is to conserve the lands and waters upon which all life depends. As a science-based organization, we develop innovative, on-the-ground solutions to the world’s toughest environmental challenges so that people and nature can thrive. Our work is guided by our values, which include a commitment to diversity and respect for people, communities, and cultures. From a rewarding mission to career development and flexible schedules, there are many reasons to love life #insideTNC. Want to know more? Check out our TNC Talent playlist on YouTube to hear stories from staff or visit Glassdoor.


One of TNC’s primary goals is to cultivate an inclusive work environment so that employees around the globe have a sense of belonging and feel that their unique contributions are valued. We know we’ll only achieve our mission by hiring and engaging a diverse staff that reflects the communities in which we work. Recognizing that people bring talent and skills that have been developed outside the scope of a job, we take a holistic approach to recruitment that considers life experience in addition to the professional requirements listed in our postings. Please apply – we’d love to hear from you. To quote a popular saying at TNC, “you’ll join for the mission, and you’ll stay for the people.”


**WHAT WE CAN ACHIEVE TOGETHER**
--------------------------------

  


The Human Dimensions (HD) Program Coordinator will work within the Global Science business unit and across organizational, disciplinary, and sectoral boundaries to coordinate strategic programs and opportunities that: advance human dimensions research excellence and promote engagement of diverse social scientists and practitioners at all career stages. This includes regularly interfacing with TNC staff and scientists in the development and maintenance of a new community of practice (CoP), as well as scheduling, communications support, research logistics and analytical support, and other project coordination activities.


Launched in 2023, the Human Dimensions Team (HDT) is a diverse team of systems thinkers and collaborative changemakers that work to accelerate TNC's impact for people and nature, through transdisciplinary and community engaged research and synthesis. The HDT occupies an important niche within the Conservancy; the team’s members bring expertise on such topics as social change, resilience and adaptation, and planetary and human health. We are driving the Conservancy to the forefront of human-centered science and identifying leverage points that accelerate positive change. We also provide partnership, mentorship, and resources for practicing scientists to develop human dimensions research that is impactful, collaborative, and oriented around a commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and justice (DEIJ).


**WE'RE LOOKING FOR YOU**
-------------------------

  


The Program Coordinator will support HDT in its mission to strengthen our capacity for inter- and transdisciplinary collaboration, accelerate conservation impact, advance world-class research, and cultivate a thriving HD community of practice. They will be a first point of contact for partners within and outside of TNC as we build community around the HDT and launch several new collaborative initiatives.


In close coordination with the HDT Director, the HD Program Coordinator will assist in the management of communications and scheduling and be a central point of contact in the development of new collaborative initiatives. They may perform regular Information Systems, Human Resources, and Finance administrative tasks, including project milestone tracking, contact management, organizing HDT file systems, and helping to prepare drafts of new reports, presentation materials, etc. They will be well versed in the systems and resources utilized by the team in order to execute assigned tasks.


In addition, the candidate will also perform some research analyst functions, including reviewing and summarizing academic literature, contributing to internal peer review of analysis, and data management. As such, this position will also support team members in writing white papers, scientific publications, and other communications.


Given the highly collaborative nature of the work, the HD Program Coordinator will also help develop relationships with other scientists, donors, and collaborators at other organizations. They will implement processes and practices to improve effectiveness, assist staff in making decisions, solving problems, and improving workflow. The HD Program Coordinator will report to the HDT Director.


**WHAT YOU'LL BRING**
---------------------



* Bachelor’s degree and 3 years related experience or equivalent combination.
* Experience generating reports and analyzing and interpreting data.
* Experience managing and implementing multiple projects.
* Experience with business process analysis and/or improvement.
* Experience with current technology in relevant field.
* Experience working with cross-functional teams.

**DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS**

* Master’s degree in a social science, conservation leadership, or related interdisciplinary field, or equivalent combination of education and experience
* Experience working on interdisciplinary research teams, ideally on topics related to the environment, conservation, international development, sustainability, or similar field.
* Experience with qualitative data analysis via software packages such as NVivo or MaxQDA
* Multi-lingual skills and multi-cultural or cross-cultural experiences are appreciated
* Experience working and scheduling across global time-zones
* Exceptional organization skills
* Experience communicating and collaborating with people in many different types of job functions and sectors
* Experience in writing for scientific, conservation and/or sustainable development audiences
* Ability to analyze information for the purpose of coordinating and planning activities, and solving problems
* Ability to use existing technology to achieve desired results
* Knowledge of the Smartsheets platform
* Excellent customer service skills and focus
* Experience interpreting guidelines to achieve desired results
* Knowledge of current trends in specific field
* Strong organization skills, accuracy, and attention to detail.


**WHAT WE BRING**
-----------------

  


Since 1951, TNC has been doing work you can believe in. Through grassroots action, we have grown from a small non-profit into one of the most effective and wide-reaching environmental organizations in the world. Thanks to more than 1 million members, over 400 scientists, and the dedicated efforts of our diverse staff and partners, we impact conservation around the world!


TNC offers a competitive, comprehensive benefits package including health care benefits, flexible spending accounts, a 401(k) plan with an 8% employer match, parental leave, accrued paid time off, life insurance, disability coverage, employee assistance program, other life and work well-being benefits. Learn more about our benefits on our Culture Tab on nature.org/careers.


We’re proud to offer a flexible work environment that supports of the health and well-being of the people we employ.


**SALARY INFORMATION**
----------------------

  


The starting pay range for a candidate selected for this position is generally within the range of $67,200 - $83,581 for annual base salary. This range only applies to candidates whose country of employment is the USA. Where a successful candidate’s actual pay will fall within this range will be based on a variety of factors, including, for example, the candidate's location, qualifications, specific skills, and experience. Please note countries outside the USA would have a different pay range in the local currency based on the local labor market, and not tied to USA pay or ranges. Your geographic location will be confirmed during the recruitment.


**APPLY NOW**
-------------

  


To apply for job ID 54784, submit your materials online by using the Apply Now button at https://careers.nature.org/. Need help applying? Visit our recruitment page or contact applyhelp@tnc.org.

**The Nature Conservancy is an Equal Opportunity Employer**. Our commitment to diversity includes the recognition that our conservation mission is best advanced by the leadership and contributions of people of diverse backgrounds, beliefs and culture. Recruiting and mentoring staff to create an inclusive organization that reflects our global character is a priority and we encourage applicants from all cultures, races, colors, religions, sexes, national or regional origins, ages, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity, military, protected veteran status or other status protected by law.

***The successful applicant must meet the requirements of The Nature Conservancy's background screening process.***


Do you have military experience? Visit our U.S. Military Skills Translator to match your military experience with our current job openings!


TNC is committed to offering accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please send a note to applyhelp@tnc.org with *Request for Accommodation* in the subject line.

*An attractive salary and benefits package is part of TNC’s value proposition to our employees. TNC strives to provide competitive pay and bases salaries on the geographic location of the role committing to being equitable across groups and providing hiring salary ranges when possible.*

*Since we support flexible and remote work for our employees, many positions have a flexible location* *within countries where we’re registered as a Non-government Organization and established as* *an employer. This may mean we’re unable to provide a hiring salary range in the posting for some of our positions. However, candidates invited to be part of our interview process will be provided their location specific range upon request.*

title: Customer Success Coordinator
description:
**Who We Are** 

StudyPoint is a national leader in the private tutoring industry. We are actively seeking enthusiastic, driven individuals to grow our team.

Our business is helping kids, and we're exceptionally good at it. Our students see dramatic gains in their academic and standardized test results, and our employees enjoy the rewards of growing a mission driven, values-based, and entrepreneurial company. Our success is driven by the people that work here and a community built around our core values:

Onward and Upward \\* Embrace Growth & Learning \\* Deliver and Expect Excellence \\* Live and Work by the Golden Rule \\* Care for One Another \\* Build Meaningful Relationships \\* Communicate, Communicate, Communicate \\* Have Fun

Our team is fun, supportive, driven, and passionate about their work. The work we do contributes to the educational success of students across the country - join a rising star in the education world and a leader in the for-profit education community!

**Position Description** 

Customer service is what sets StudyPoint apart from the competition. As a part of our Service Team, you will be responsible for fostering great relationships between students, families, and tutors. You’ll also collaborate with our enrollment and academics teams to ensure families and tutors are set up for success. You’ll support and assist in growing the business by providing exceptional customer service and achieving monthly revenue goals.

**Responsibilities**

* Partner with a senior program manager to provide high quality customer service to as many as 400+ StudyPoint students and families.
* Support our amazing staff of tutors by being responsive via phone/email/text to their questions and concerns.
* Assist in providing high-level administrative organization for family accounts; conduct research, track data, handle information requests, prepare correspondence, schedule consultations, and schedule meetings.
* Help grow the business by selling programs to new and existing customers using a consultative sales approach.
* Achieve metrics-driven goals including customer revenue (new and repeat sales), referral generation, and conversion rates.
* Receive frequent coaching and feedback, as well as ongoing training and development, to continuously hone your sales and customer service skills.

**Requirements**

* Excellent interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to work with a wide variety of customers and employees.
* Ability to multitask and handle a high volume of calls and emails.
* Careful attention to detail and ability to adapt to new processes to improve efficiency.
* Excited to work in an environment with shifting priorities, adjust to, and learn new systems.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills and excellent organizational skills.
* Proficiency with Google Suite, Microsoft Office and experience working with a CRM database.
* Excitement to take on increasing responsibility and grow within the company.
* Experience working in a small, entrepreneurial environment a plus.
* Bachelor’s degree required.
* Access to a dedicated home office, including high-speed internet connection. We provide all of the technology you need.

**Benefits**

* Competitive salary with option to move to performance-based commission plans after an initial training period. Salary range starts at $42,000 - $50,000 DOE.
* Three weeks paid time off in your first year with 9 paid holidays, plus your birthday off.
* Annual paid volunteer day to do community service/charity work.
* Health, vision, and dental coverage options.
* Significant discounts on tutoring for family members.
* 401k option.
* Work from home.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $42,000.00 - $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Weekly day range:

* Monday to Friday

Work setting:

* Remote

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Work Location: Remote

description:

We provide services to Independent Physician Associations, TPAs, and Fiscal Intermediary clients. ACTY is a modern growing company which encourages diverse perspectives. title: Talent Acquisition Coordinator
description:
As a Talent Acquisition Coordinator, you are a relationship builder and trusted communicator. You easily build credibility with external candidates and internal stakeholders of all levels. You are a process and organizational whiz, using effective approaches to stay at the top of your game. You’re a people person who is passionate about bringing top talent into organizations.


Sound like you? Keep reading for more detail.


Snapsheet is seeking a Talent Acquisition Coordinator to support the Recruiting function and be a strategic partner with the operations organization. You’ll have the ability to impact hiring strategies, from sourcing candidates, coordinating communications, managing the internal process, influencing debriefs and assisting in the onboarding process. This is a high-volume, full cycle recruiting role in which you will have an immediate impact on the team and on the growth of Snapsheet!


What You'll Do:

* Source candidates from internal and external applicant tracking systems and multiple job boards to acquire the best talent for a multitude of teams and roles
* Conduct thorough phone screens and video interviews to gauge the candidates hard and soft skills as well as make sure they have a solid understanding of the job duties and company expectations
* Be the main point of contact for candidates going through the hiring process to address questions and keep them engaged
* Take ownership of day-to-day interactions between the Talent team and candidates
* Use CRM software to track and document all candidate interactions
* Facilitate communications between recruiters and hiring managers (scheduling interviews, monitoring pre-employment testing, etc.)
* Pulling reports and data to understand recruiting formulas and using the data to keep stakeholders informed
* Other projects as necessary


What You Have:

* 1-2+ Years working in a dynamic staffing environment
* Ability to read and assess candidate profiles to make accurate, efficient decisions in hiring
* Skill to assess hiring manager's requirements in order to find a matching candidate
* Desire to work in a startup environment, with proactive mindset and minimum need for supervision
* Persistent, go-getter attitude and determination to deliver results
* Excellent written and verbal communication
* Highly organized and strong work ethic


Additionally, we expect our Talent Acquisition Coordinator (and every other Snapster) to hold true to our values:

* You do the right thing.
* You default to action.
* You are always looking for the next great thing and creating it.
* You remember the feeling - of failure, of success, of fear - and you have empathy.
* You collaborate and always remember we are stronger united.


#LI-REMOTE  

#BI-REMOTE**Snapsheet is an equal opportunity employer.**
